loans.name: Dallas

texts.en: Dallas is 25 years old, single with no children. She has a small bingo business, which she has been running for one year. Dallas needs a loan to buy a new bingo machine, bingo paper, a desk, and a chair. She will use her profits to improve her business. Dallas joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new bingo machine, bingo paper, a desk, and a chair.

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en: Miraflor is married with two children. She runs a general store in their village to supplement her husband's income from farming. With three years in the business, Miraflor is doing well. She is requesting a loan through GDMPC to purchase more grocery goods to resell. She hopes to gain more profit to use for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is 62 years old, a widow and has 3 adult children. She lives in Sepac Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. Celerina  has engaged in  the cocoa farming business since the moment she got married. This is the one source of her income. She earns a bimonthly income of 9000 PHP.

Celerina requested a new loan to buy materials such as lumber and to pay for labor for house renovations. She has been a CUMi member of Paglaum MPC since 2005.

loans.use: to  purchase  materials for house renovations.

loans.name: Kadhe

texts.en: Kadhe appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners. She thanks Yehu for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for growing maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a TV and slush beverage machine for his restaurant.

loans.name: Maryory Alexandra

texts.es:
Maryory, a sus 27 años de edad, desea sacar adelante su proyecto de compra de mercancía como ropa, perfumes, entre otros, para realizar ventas al mostrador.

Ella busca generar ingresos para su sostenimiento y ayudar a su familia. Su objetivo con el crédito es poder hacer su primer inventario y comenzar a ofrecer sus productos a sus amigos, los cuales están dispuestos a ayudarle.

Su gran sueño es poder montar un almacén fuera de su casa, con una excelente vitrina, y ayudando a la sociedad generando posibilidades de empleo.
texts.en:
Maryory, 27, wants to move forward with her project of purchasing merchandise such as clothing, perfumes, and others, for her sales counter. She seeks to generate income to support and help her family. 

Her goal is to be able to purchase her first inventory and start selling her products to her friends who are willing to buy from her.  

Her dream is to build a store out of her house with an excellent showcase and help her community by generating employment opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as clothing and perfumes.

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es:
Reina de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 están acompañadas y la última que está estudiando 1er  grado, una de las hijas que está acompañada vive aún en su casa al igual que la última. Con ella solo vive una hermana y dos sobrinas.


La señora tiene un negocio de elaboración, comercialización de matates ( Harcia ) ella lleva ya 3 años de dedicarse esta actividad, aprendió el oficio, porque una prima le enseño, vio que era una actividad que le podía generar ingresos para los gastos familiares; fue así como decidió dedicarse a ello. Antes de ser artesana trabajaba en un comedor de cocinera en la capital del país. El trabajo lo realiza en su casa, solo tiene que viajar cuando entrega el producto. A ella le ayuda su pequeña hija a realizar el trabajo. Para trabajar no tiene un horario establecido, si no que a cualquier hora cuando ha terminado los oficios domésticos.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar  30 conos de pita, el torno porque el que tiene es alquilado, comprara la carreta que es para hilar la pita. Mejorará sus ingresos, ya que tendrá su propio equipo de trabajo

Ella pretende ampliar su negocio y lo hará comprando más materia prima, para dar trabajo a una prima para aumentar así sus ingresos, con las ganancias piensa ayudar a su hija, para que estudie  y no se quede a mitad del camino y que pueda un día ser profesional .
texts.en:
Reina is 33 years old. She finish Grade 1. She has 3 children. Two are in common-law relationships and the other is in Grade one. One of the married daughters and the youngest daughter live with her. A sister and two nieces also live with her.

Reina has a business making and selling bags. She has been doing this for three years. She was taught this by a cousin and realized that it was an activity that could generate revenues to pay the household expenses so she decided to do it. Before she became an artisan she worked in a restaurant in the capital.

She works in her house and only has to go out to sell the product. Her young daughter helps her with the work. She has no fixed hours, she does it whenever she has completed the household chores.

The loan the Reina is requesting is to buy 30 cones of algave thread, a spinning wheel because the one she has is rented and spools to put the thread on. She will increase her income as she has her own equipment. She wants to expand her business and buy more raw material to give work to a cousin and to make more money. She wants to help her daughter with the profits so that she can study and not stop in mid- flight and one day become a professional.

loans.use: to buy 30 cones of algave thread, spinning wheel and spools.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is 52 years old and married with six children.

Anselma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow  to buy additional items like coffee, sugar, cream, detergent soap, hair conditioner, etc. to sell.

Anselma has borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

Anselma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like coffee, sugar, cream, detergent soap, hair conditioner, etc. to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 50 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising cattle in the Philippines. Thelma is borrowing PHP 15000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

Thelma has been raising cattle for 11 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 38 years old and married; she has six children. With three of her children still in school, Cynthia works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as noodles, salt, sugar, bread, and canned goods.

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more stock to sell, like noodles, salt, sugar, bread, and canned goods. Cynthia would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell at her store, like noodles, salt, and canned goods

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.en:
Magnolia is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a welding shop business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income by farming rice.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional materials for her welding shop business.

Magnolia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her welding shop business

loans.name: Samin

texts.en: Samin appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan of KES 15,000 to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients, such as sugar, milk, eggs, etc. for her food vending business.

Melanie has been in this business for three years. Melanie earns more income from buying and selling dried fish.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients, such as sugar, milk, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi operates a food selling business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. The previous loan helped her boost her business by buying food stuffs for her business. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a 32-year-old lady.  She is living with her husband and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  At the time when she was newly married, their financial condition was very poor because her husband did not have much skill to work on a lathe machine.  He has been learning the techniques to work on a lathe machine from professionals. Now he has come to know how to operate a lathe machine so that he can carry on his newly started business. Due to his lack of experience, the lathe machine has gotten damaged and needs maintenance. 

Therefore, Noor requested a loan for her husband so that he can fulfill the deficiencies of the lathe machine and can buy additional tools, dyes, spare parts, etc. Noor is tension free now because she hopes that her husband will become an expert soon and get a reasonable income as an expert turner.

Noor is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: with the maintenance of a lathe machine and to buy additional spare parts, tools, dyes and a cutter to work on a lathe machine.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura es una joven campesina y luchadora que, a sus 21 años de edad ya es madre de un hijo de 4 años y vive en unión libre con su compañero sentimental.  Desde que era pequeña sus padres le enseñaron todo lo relacionado con las tareas del campo y, gracias a ello ha podido trabajar como empleada en diferentes fincas lecheras, encargándose del cuidado y ordeño de las vacas. Hace algún tiempo obtuvo sus primeras vacas productoras de leche y, desde entonces se ha encargado de sacar adelante su negocio de manera independiente, toda la producción es vendida y de esta manera genera los recursos económicos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con el sustento del hogar. Actualmente solicita nuestro apoyo, pues con el crédito desea comprar dos vacas productoras de leche que le permitirán aumentar la producción y así hacerle frente a los desafíos que se le presentan con los bajos precios de venta y con los altos costos de los insumos agrícolas que requiere para el cuidado de los animales; sin embargo ella es consciente que para lograr sus objetivos, debe continuar luchando con esmero, disciplina y dedicación, sólo así podrá alcanzar el sueño de ampliar su negocio y adquirir mayor número de cabezas de ganado lechero que le garanticen una estabilidad económica favorable para poder brindar una mejor educación a su hijo y disfrutar mejor calidad de vida en compañía de sus seres amados.
texts.en:
Laura is a young struggling farmer, 21 years old, and the mother of a 4 year old son. She lives accompanied by her life partner. Ever since she was young her parents have taught her everything related to farm work, and as a result she has been able to work as an employee on various dairy farms.

She is in charge of caring for and milking the cows. Some time ago she obtained her first dairy cows and since then she has been handling the success of her business independently. Everything produced is sold and so this generates the financial resources sufficient to assist her husband with the household expenses.

Currently she is asking for help with financing as she wants to buy two dairy cows which will permit her to increase her production and thus cope with the challenges she faces such as low sale prices and the high cost of agricultural supplies that she needs to care for the animals. However, she is aware that to achieve her goals, she must continue fighting with care, discipline, and dedication. Only then will she be able to achieve the dream of expanding her business and of buying a greater number of dairy cattle that will guarantee a favorable financial stability in order to be able to offer her son a better education and to enjoy a better quality of life in the company of her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, se dedica hacer pan como forma de tener ingresos para salir adelante con su familia, la apoya su hijo, ella vive una casa propia con su hijo y su nieto. Por el momento su negocio no representa ningún problema.
El crédito lo utilizara para comprar harinas, levadura, royal, azúcar, sal, para surtir el inventario de su negocio y tener la materia prima necesaria para continuar respondiendo  a la demanda de sus clientes, espera aumentar sus ventas y tener una mejor economía.
Su sueño es tener un negocio rentable para cancelar sus deudas y que sea auto sostenible.
texts.en:
Maria makes bread as a way of having income to make progress for her family. Her son helps her. She lives in her own house with her son and her grandson. At this time, she is not having any problems with her business.

She will use the loan to buy flours, yeast, Royal brand baking powder, sugar, and salt to stock the inventory for her business and have the basic ingredients necessary to continue responding to the demand of her customers. She hopes to increase her sales and have a better [household] economy.

Her dream is to have a profitable business to pay her debts and be self-supporting.

loans.use: to buy flours, yeast, Royal brand baking powder, sugar, and salt

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more goods like noodles, shampoo, cooking oil, vinegar, laundry soap, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Sheila has been in this business for 7 years. Sheila earns more income from buying and selling natural medicine.

Sheila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more goods like noodles, shampoo, cooking oil, vinegar, laundry soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en: Sreymom is 27-years-old.  She is married and lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She has been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $5 per day.  Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) is a driver who makes an income of $6 daily. Due to the lack of funds, Sreymom is requesting a loan of $1,300 to purchase construction materials to build a new house. This money will help her obtain a convenient house for her family. In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop at home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a new house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials: cement, sand, blocks, iron, and gravel

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia works hard to support her family. Denia is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

Denia requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional unit for her business.

Denia has been in this business for three years now.

Denia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional unit for her bicycle transport business.

loans.name: Scolastica

texts.en:
Scolastica is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients, such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, detergents, maize flour, and sugar, which will help her invest back into her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.  She still operates her food stall.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, tea leaves, maize flour and sugar that will help her to invest back into her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, tea leaves, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Luz Andrea

texts.es: Luz, a sus 33 años de edad, es casada y madre de 1 hijo. Durante su vida productiva se ha desempeñado en el campo de las ventas, inicialmente en un almacén de ropa donde aprendió la actividad, pero con el ánimo de independizarse y generar mejores ingresos decidió montar su propio negocio con la liquidación y algunos ahorros personales; es un almacén donde vende ropa de combate y variedades como juguetes, artículos decorativos para el hogar, accesorios, entre otros. Actualmente solicita nuestro apoyo para comprar surtido de mercancía al por mayor (juguetes, ropa, accesorios, entre otros), así podrá abastecerse lo suficiente para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada de navidad, beneficiando directamente la entrada de recursos económicos para solventar las necesidades básicas de su familia. El principal anhelo de Luz es poder tener un local propio que le permita ahorrar dinero y mejorar la rentabilidad para garantizar una estabilidad económica que le permita brindar una mejor educación a su hijo para que tenga un futuro más próspero y exitoso.
texts.en: Luz, 33, is married and has one child. During her working life, she has been involved in the field of sales, initially in a clothing store where she learned to do this activity. In the spirit of independence and to generate better revenues, she decided to start her own business with her severance pay and her own personal savings. It is a store where she sells army apparel and an assortment of other items such as toys, decorative items for the home, accessories, and more. She currently requested our support to buy an assortment of wholesale merchandise (toys, clothes, accessories, and more) so she can stock enough to meet demand increases during the Christmas season, directly benefiting her earnings to allow her to cover the basic needs of her family. Luz's main desire is to own her own establishment that allows her to save money and improve profitability to ensure financial stability to enable her to provide a better education for her child to have a prosperous and success future.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of wholesale merchandise such as toys, clothing, accessories, and others.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 39 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Jenny is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jenny has been in the pig fattening business for seven years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Frediswenda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Frediswenda works hard to support her family.

She has a feed and rice retailing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock. Frediswenda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed and rice to sell. 

Frediswenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed and rice to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice and feed business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice and feed to sell. 

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years. Teresita earns more income from raising livestock.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice and feed to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a new website, a computer and software for her business

loans.name: Phek

texts.en: Phek is 30 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been working as a sanitation worker for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $5 daily. Due to a lack of funds, Phek is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase timber to build a new house. This money will help her obtain a convenient house for her family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store from her home and help her children earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build a new house

loans.name: Pingky

texts.en:
Pingky is married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Pingky is 40-years-old and has three children who are in school.

Pingky has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. Pingky requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Pingky has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Pingky would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Dianne

texts.en:
Dianne is 26 years old, has a live-in partner and is the mother of two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Dianne has a direct-selling Avon Products business in the Philippines. Dianne has requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional Avon products to sell, such as lotion, lipstick, perfume, body soap, etc.

Dianne has been in this business for one year. In the future, Dianne would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional Avon products to sell, such as lotion, lipstick, perfume, body soap, etc.

loans.name: Narcesta

texts.en:
Narcesta is 41-years-old and single.

Narcesta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buying and selling business of dried coconut meat in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of dried coconut to sell.

Narcesta has borrowed and paid twenty-one loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buying and selling business of dried coconut meat for seven years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice grains.

Narcesta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of dried coconut to sell.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores works hard to support her family. Dolores is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

Dolores requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

Dolores has been in this business for three years now.

Dolores would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María, a sus 34 años de edad, es casada y madre de tres hijos de 11, 3 y 1 años de edad. Hace 5 años comenzó a realizar la actividad de venta de productos por catálogo, con el fin de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía del hogar; sus principales clientes son familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector y, ella manifiesta que la principal ventaja es que puede ser productiva sin necesidad de descuidar sus hijos y su hogar. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor (perfumería, cosméticos, accesorios, cremas faciales y corporales, entre otros), para aprovechar los descuentos que obtiene, lo que le permitirá mejorar el margen de utilidades por cada venta que realice, además podrá fidelizar más a sus clientes ya que tendrá el producto para entregarlo inmediatamente, ya que eso estimula la decisión de compra. María sólo desea poder continuar con su actividad para garantizar a sus hijos una estabilidad económica que le permita brindarles mejor educación y mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Maria, 34, is married and is the mother of three children aged 11, 3, and 1 years old. Five years ago, she began her business selling products by catalog in order to generate income to contribute to the household economy. Her main customers are family, friends, and neighbors in the area. She says that the main advantage is that she can be productive without neglecting her children and her home. She is currently seeking the support of this loan to purchase merchandise in bulk such as perfumes, cosmetics, accessories, face and body creams, and more to take advantage of the discounts she gets which will allow her to improve the profit margins for each sales she makes. She will also get to retain more customers because she will be able to deliver their products immediately which encourages their decision to purchase. Maria just wants to continue with her activities to ensure financial stability for her children, allowing her to provide better education and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale merchandise including perfumes, cosmetics, accessories, and face and body creams.

loans.name: Kanyonge

texts.en:
Kanyonge is a married woman with nine children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a business of selling leso (female wrap) cloth. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase 40 pieces of Lesos (women's wraps) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 40 pieces of Lesos (women's wraps) for resale.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 53-year-old married woman and the mother of eight children. She has been running a business selling clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her area. She has become famous for selling good-quality clothes in her community. 

Currently, Shahnaz has taken her first loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy a stock of different clothes for the winter season. She will take into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the winter season to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fixed assets (refrigerator, freezer, tables and chairs, blender, kitchen utensils, other items) and the  necessary ingredients (ice cream, fruit, wafers, toppings).

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and has five children, four in school and one underage. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables and school fees.

For over two years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women as well as curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business

loans.name: Pao

texts.en:
Pao is 41 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $4 each day. Her children are employed; they earn about $14 daily. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Pao is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to run her own tailoring shop and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Liliana Esmeralda

texts.es: la clienta de 25 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hija en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio y de calidad, ella solicita un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor como:  naranjas, piñas, fresas, guineos, papayas, etc. y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Liliana is 25 years old. She lives with her life companion and her daughter in their own home. She sells vegetables and fruit. She has been doing this for a number of years and has gained a lot of experience in which sales can make the most profit. The place where she sells is very good for her business plus it has a lot of foot traffic. She has a lot of clients who prefer her because her product is fresh, of good quality and price. She is requesting a loan which will allow her to buy fruit and vegetables wholesale like: oranges, pineapple, strawberries, bananas, papaya, etc. She wants to make more money to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables wholesale like oranges, pineapple, strawberries, bananas, papaya, etc.

loans.name: Maria Otilia

texts.es: Doña maría de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos quienes trabajan  y le ayudan en los gastos de su hogar, desde hace varios años ella se dedica  a la venta de ropa lo hace de forma ambulante por la diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de sus hijos logran salir adelante con los gastos que se les presentan, Doña Maria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con sus hijos.
texts.en: Maria is 55 years old and lives in her own house with her four children who work and help with household expenses.  For several years she has worked selling clothes traveling to different neighborhoods that are close to her home. With the earnings that she obtains and with the help of her children they achieve coming out ahead of the expenses that come up. Maria is requesting a loan to buy clothes at wholesale to be able to continue with her business and to be able to have a better quality of life together with her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Recitita

texts.en:
Recitita is 53 years old and married with five children. With two children currently in school, Recitita works very hard to provide for them.

Recitita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Recitita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, soft drinks, milk, etc. 

Recitita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furniture and goods for the bedroom.

loans.name: Santos Alexander

texts.es:
SANTOS DE 41 AÑOS DE EDAD,  ESTUDIO HASTA SEPTIMO GRADO, POR MOTIVOS ECONOMICOS. ÉL ESTA CASADO Y SU ESPOSA SE DEDICA A LOS OFICIOS DE LA CASA, SU HIJO DE 13 AÑOS ES EL QUE LE AYUDA A TRABAJAR EN LA AGRICULTURA. 


 TODA SU VIDA SE A DEDICADO A TRABAJAR EN LA AGRICULTURA, EMPEZO A TRABAJAR CON SU PADRE, PUES ÉL ERA UNO DE LOS MAYORES POR LO TANTO TENIA QUE AYUDARLE A TRABAJAR, PARA GANAR EL SUSTENTO DE TODA SU FAMILIA, ÉL TIENE QUE CAMINAR CERCA DE 2 KILOMETROS PARA LLEGAR HASTA DONDE TIENE SU CULTIVO Y PRACTICAMENTE NO TIENE HORARIO, YA QUE DEPENDE DEL CULTIVO Y SE ACOMPAÑA DE SU HIJO DESPUES QUE SALE DE LA ESCUELA YA QUE LE ESTA ENSEÑANDO COMO TRABAJAR LA TIERRA.

CON EL DINERO DEL PRESTAMO, COMPRARA SEMILLAS, ABONO Y TODOS LOS INSUMOS QUE VA A NECESITAR EN LOS 7,000 METROS CUADRADOS DE MAIZ QUE VA A CULTIVAR. 


LOS SUEÑOS SON TENER UNA CASA EN MEJORES CONDICIONES DE LAS QUE AHORA TIENE, TAMBIEN PODER DARLE TODO A SUS HIJOS, EL ESTUDIO QUE ÉL NO TUVO. CON EL PRESTAMO  SABE QUE ES UN COMPROMISO PERO A LA VEZ TIENE CLARO QUE LE SERVIRA COMO UN IMPULSO PARA TRABAJAR MAS Y EN MEJORES CONDICIONES Y SABE QUE SOLO LO LOGRARA A BASE DE MUCHO ESFUERZO.
texts.en:
Santos is 41 years old. He went to school through the seventh grade, due to economic reasons. He is married, and his wife takes care of the house. His son who is 13 is the one who helps him work in agriculture.

He has worked in agriculture all his life. He began to work with his father, since he was one of the oldest, and so he had to help him work to earn a living for the whole family. He has to walk about 2 kilometers to arrive at his field. He doesn't have a regular schedule, since it depends on the crop, and his son accompanies him after he leaves school, since he is teaching him how to work the land.

With the money from the loan, he will buy seeds, fertilizer, and all the supplies that he is going to need for the 7000 square meters of corn that he is going to grow.

His dreams are to have a house in better conditions than those he has now, and also to be able to give all his children the education he did not have. With the loan, he knows that it is a commitment, but he also knows well that it will serve as an incentive to work more and in better conditions, and he knows he will only achieve it based on much effort.

loans.use: to buy the seeds, fertilizer, and all the supplies that he is going to need for the 7000 square meters of corn that he is going to grow

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas to resell in her buy-and-sell banana business.

Teresita has been in this business for three years. Teresita earns more income from raising livestock.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to resell.

loans.name: Theavy

texts.en: Theavy is 40 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is an excavator driver who earns about $4 daily. Due to a lack of funds, Theavy is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase timber to fix her house. This money will help her provide better living condition for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase timber to fix her house

loans.name: Nemeh

texts.en:
Nemeh is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. Nemeh is a 29-year-old married woman from a small village near Gaza city. She lives with her husband and five kids- two sons and three daughters- in a simple house. Nemeh's husband works in the public sector and earns a low income. Nemeh could not complete her studies directly after school, so she registered recently in the university to get a BA degree. She studies Elementary Education. She would like to finish her studies to find a job and help her husband with part of the family's expenses.

Nemeh took a 625 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop to study. By taking this loan, Nemeh will be able to do her homework and write the reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop to study

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. Edna is married and has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines.

Edna has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business, such as nail polish, a nail cutter, a nipper, etc.

Edna has been in this business for 10 years now. Edna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business, such as nail polish, a nail cutter, a nipper, etc.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Edna is 44 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Edna has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

Edna has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Edna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
Carolyn is 33 years old and married with four children. With four children surrently in school, Carolyn works very hard to provide for them.

Carolyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods, such as canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, milk, coffee, etc. to sell.

Carolyn has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, milk, coffee, etc. 

Carolyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods, such as canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, milk, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Necita

texts.en:
Necita is 34 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Necita is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional seeds for her farm.

Necita has been farming vegetables for two years and earns additional income from providing motorcycle transport and farming coconut.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds for her farm

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Editha is 38 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Editha has a retailing rice business in the Philippines. Editha requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Editha has been in this business for two years. In the future, Editha would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Azhar

texts.en:
Azhar, 25, is a single woman who lives in the City of Jenin in northern Palestine. To help  two of her family members, Azhar  has decided to take a loan from the Arab Center for Agricultural Development. 

Azhar has suffered from hearing impairments since birth and is unable to engage in the Palestinian labor market. As a result, she has decided to begin her own project, a tailoring project, and to depend on it as a main source of income.

Azhar has begun her project with part of her own money and has borrowed some from ACAD to purchase sewing machines. Her goal is to expand this project, since it provides the only source of livelihood for her and her sister.

Azhar's challenges are hearing disabilities and a lack of people who deal with her, in addition to the difficulty of marketing.

She would like to thank ACAD and Kiva for giving her this chance to share her story.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma requested a loan for her husband to buy an ice cream making machine. He wants to start to offer ice cream in the evening to the children of his area. For this purpose, he needs an ice cream making machine, milk, powder, etc., to start this business. In the morning he works at a small job in a firm for a low salary.

Najma is 38 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children, who live in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Najma hopes that through this machine her husband will be able to earn additional income. Najma thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan team.

loans.use: To buy an ice cream making machine to make ice cream to sell in the community.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with children who attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

She has operated a business of mat weaving for sale, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding and establishing a big business.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase beads and sewing materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase beads and sewing materials

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo ella podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda como maderas, clavos, calaminas, entre otros, de esta manear podrá mejorar el techo de su vivienda sobre todo ahora que es temporada de lluvias, Edith podrá seguir trabajando en su negocio de venta de comidas con mayor tranquilidad y seguira luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una mejor casa”.
texts.en: Edith is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their great support she will be able to buy construction materials such as wood, nails, and corrugated metal sheets, among other items, to be able to make improvements in her house. Above all, she will be able to improve the roof of her home now that it is the rainy season. Edith will be able to continue working with greater tranquility in her business of selling food, and she will continue to strive to make a reality of her great dream: to have a better house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es: Don José, tiene 62 años de edad, es  casado, tiene dos 2 hijos y vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. El tiene su propio negocio de  taller de tapicería en general, repara muebles de sala, asientos de motos, de carros y sillas en general. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 20 años y funciona  en su casa. Lleva tres ciclos de préstamos con el actual, el cual es por 15,000 lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como telas, esponja, pegamento, grapas y otros, para tapizar un lote de sillas que le han pedido sus clientes y así va cumplir con sus compromisos de trabajo. Su meta es seguir trabajando para poder ver a sus hijos graduados.
texts.en: José is 62 years old. He is married and has two children. He lives in the municipality of San Pedro Sula. He has his own upholstery business, repairing living room furniture, car and motorcycle seats and chairs in general. He has had this business for 20 years and works out of his house.This will be his third loan cycle. This loan is for 15,000 HNL and he will invest it buying raw materials like fabric, sponge, glue, staples, etc to upholster a group of chairs for his clients to fulfill his work commitments. His goal is to continue working to see his children graduate.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like fabric, sponge, glue, staples, etc to upholster some chairs for his clients.

loans.name: Amorlita

texts.en:
Amorlita is 30 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Amorlita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Amorlita has been pig fattening for four years, and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to resell in her buy-and-sell charcoal business.

Melba has been in this business for five years. Melba earns more income from a general store.

Melba has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es:
El es luis felipe, escogió auxiliar de servicios farmacéuticos porque le gusta la parte de la salud para poder servirle a aquellas personas que necesitan de esta atención, ya sea por la parte de los medicamentos o dispositivos médicos, a parte de esto porque la salud es una carrera donde se aprenden muchas cosas interesantes y buenas, las cuales le pueden servir a la comunidad, una de esas podría ser la parte de inyecto logia.
Esta carrera la escogió porque la farmacia tiene muchos temas interesantes y también porque los ingresos económicos  son buenos, el convenio con kiva realmente seria una gran ayuda muy buena porque no cuenta con los ingresos adecuados para pagarse la carrera completa.
Con este logro, como lo es terminar la carrera de auxiliar de farmacia es mas adelante, en un futuro, poder formar su propio establecimiento farmacéutico como lo seria droguería, entre esas y poder contar con unos ingresos buenos y estables para poder ayudar con las labores de su casa, y a si poder adelante y tener su propia casa en un futuro mas adelante.
Al terminar este técnico el podría ayudar a muchas personas con la parte de la salud podrá servirle a la comunidad con algo que se trata todos los días.
texts.en:
This is Luis Felipe. He chose the pharmacy assistant program because he likes this area of health which deals with being able to help people who require such attention, whether it be in regard to medicine or medical devices. Aside from this, he also likes it because many interesting and positive things are learned from this program. These things can be of service for the community, such as the knowledge of administering injections. 

He chose this program because pharmaceutical sciences have many interesting topics and also because the salaries are good. The agreement with Kiva will truly be a very great help because he does not have the adequate income to pay for the entire program. 
 
After completing his pharmacy assistant program in the future, he would like to set up his own pharmaceutical establishment later on, such as a drugstore. Also, he would like to be able to rely on a good, stable income to be able to help with housework, and so be able to get ahead and own his own home later on in the future. 

Upon completing this program, he would be able to help many people in the area of health. He will be able to serve the community with something that he is involved with on a daily basis.

loans.use: to pay his tuition for a semester.

loans.name: Ma. Josefina

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Ma. Josefina works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising livestock. Ma. Josefina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers in her fish vending business.

Ma. Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 33 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening in the Philippines. Lorna is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

Lorna has been pig fattening for 10 years, and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks to resell in her general store.

Perla has been in this business for seven years. Perla earns more income from raising livestock.

Perla has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to resell in her general store.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to resell in her fish vending business.

Salvacion has been in this business for seven years. Salvacion earns more income from raising livestock.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to resell.

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.es: Don Anselmo, es un señor dedicado a la actividad comercial de venta de prendas de acero y plata,  negocio que le ha permitido subsistir en la vida, tiene un hijo en edad escolar, don Anselmo es soltero, con este crédito que solicita busca incrementar las ventas y abastecerse de productos para seguir vendiendo, tanto en el mercado como en su casa de habitación, espera con esta inversión mejorar su economía aprovechando esta buena temporada de fin de año.
texts.en: Anselmo sells jewelry made of steel and silver and his business provides him with enough income to get by.  He is single and has a school-age son.  With the loan he is requesting he is seeking to increase his sales and stock up on products so he can keep selling at the market and at his home. He hopes that this loan will allow him to improve his finances by taking advantage of increased sales at the end of the year.

loans.use: to invest in silver and steel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a drill press and a hydraulic press

loans.name: Esperanza Angelica

texts.es:
Angelica vive en al ciudad de Chiclayo, trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, el cual pudo iniciar gracias a su esfuerzo y sobre todo ahorro; Angélica es madre de 1 hijo, al cual quiere mucho y su motor para salir adelante.

Angelica esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá comprar abarrotes para su negocio como arroz al por mayor, azúcar, fideos, entre otros con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio y de esta manera poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:”poder tener un minimarket”.
texts.en: Angelica lives in the city of Chiclayo. She works in her small business of selling groceries. She was able to start it thanks to her effort and above all, savings. Angelica is the mother of one son who she loves very much and who is her driving force to get ahead. Angelica is grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to their support she will be able to buy groceries for her business such as wholesale rice, sugar and noodles, among other things. With these she will be able to supply her business and in this way make her great dream a reality: "to be able to have a mini-market".

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Junior Alexander

texts.es: Junior, tiene 21 años, vive en casa familiar con su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 1 y 2 años. Actualmente trabaja en una empresa agrícola de su localidad como operario de campo. Beneficiario utilizará el crédito para compra de una cuna para el menor de sus hijos y otros enseres domésticos. Su sueño es tener una empresa propia que le permita generar mayores ingresos que le permita mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y comprarse su casita.
texts.en: Junior is 21 years old. He live in his family home with his wife and two children, aged 1 and 2.  Right now he is working at an agricultural business in his community as a field worker. He will use the loan to buy a cradle for his youngest child and other household items. His dream is to have his own business that will allow him to generate more income that will enable him to improve his family's quality of life and buy a little house.

loans.use: to buy a cradle and household items for his youngest child.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona is 56 years old, and she manages a sari-sari (variety) store business.She has been involved in this kind of business for almost 16 years.

She knows that the more items she stocks in her store, the more the income she will gain. With regards to this matter ,she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000, which will allow her to buy additional grocery items such as shampoo, biscuits, drinks, eggs, soap and candies. She believes that through completeness of the grocery items she offers to her locality, she will be able to give satisfaction to her costumers and at the same time she could earn s higher income.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items such as shampoo, biscuits, drinks, eggs, soap and candies for her general store

loans.name: Gladis Yolanda

texts.es: Gladys, tiene 46 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 2 hijos, vive en el municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, hace 3 años que estableció una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica, vende  granos básicos, azúcar, jabón, papel higiénico, carnes, churros, dulces, pan, manteca, y también ollas de cocina. El préstamo que solicita es el segundo ciclo y es por 20,000 lempiras, con este préstamo espera surtir de productos alimenticios como granos básicos, azúcar, jabón, manteca, carnes, churros y otros abarrotes, con el propósito de obtener mejores utilidades. Tiene como meta, seguir trabajando y obtener mejores ganancias y así poder tener un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en: Gladis is 46 years old and lives in a common law marriage with her husband with whom she has two kids. She lives in the city of Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. She has always worked in business and three years ago she set up a convenience store where she sells staple goods: basic grains, sugar, soap, toilet paper, meats, donuts, candies, bread, butter, and also cooking pots. The loan that she is requesting is the second cycle and is for 20,000 lempiras. With this loan she hopes to stock food products like basic grains, sugar, soap, butter, meats, donuts, and other groceries with the purpose of gaining better profits. She has as a goal to continue working and obtain better earnings and so to be able to have a better style of life.

loans.use: to stock food products like basic grains, sugar, soap, butter, meats, donuts, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carmelita is 43 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Carmelita has a buy-and-sell school supplies and medicines business in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a PHP 26,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of school supplies and medicines to resell.

Carmelita has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Carmelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of school supplies and medicines to resell.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Mona works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell plastic rope (straw) business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising livestock. Mona is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to resell to her customers in her buy-and-sell plastic rope (straw) business.

Mona has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of plastic rope (straw) to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables and additional ingredients for her business.

Visitacion has been in this business for two years. Visitacion earns more income from buying and selling livestock.

Visitacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 39 years old and is married with five children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Tessie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Tessie has been in pig fattening for seven years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
As the married parent of three children, Juanita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Juanita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 49 years old and married with eight children.

Zenaida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Zenaida has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Zenaida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: José Jesús

texts.es: José es un campesino de 46 años de edad, nacido en el seno de una familia muy humilde que le enseñó desde muy pequeño a realizar todas las tareas del campo para que cuando creciera pudiera conseguir su propio sustento; gracias a ello, hace más de 31 años, se dedica a la agricultura, ya que posee cultivos de maíz, fríjol y curuba; además tiene ganado de levante y es productor lechero, toda la producción que saca de sus diferentes actividades, es vendida para generar los ingresos suficientes para solventar los gastos de su familia, conformada por su esposa y dos hijos de 8 y 6 años. Con el ánimo de darle continuidad a sus actividades, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar dos vacas productoras de leche que entrarán a reemplazar a dos animales que están en período de gestación; así podrá mantener su nivel de producción para poder hacerle frente a los desafíos que se le presentan por los altos costos de los insumos agrícolas que requiere y a los bajos precios de venta de sus productos. José dice que su principal meta es lograr ampliar su producción de leche, pues tiene mucho espacio disponible para tener más animales y así poder lograr una estabilidad financiera que le ayude a brindar un mejor futuro y bienestar a sus hijos y su esposa.
texts.en: José is a farmer of 46. He was born into a very humble family who taught him when he was very young to do all the farm chores so that when he was grown he could earn his own livelihood. Thanks to that, he has worked in agriculture for more than 31 years, and he now has plantings of corn, beans, and passion fruit. In addition, he has breeding cattle and produces milk. All the production that he obtains from his different activities is sold to generate sufficient income to pay the expenses of his family, which consists of his wife and two children, ages 8 and 6. With the intention of continuing his activities, he is applying for the support of the loan to buy two milk cows that will replace two animals that are in a period of gestation. Thus he will be able to maintain his level of production so that he will be able to face the challenges that are presented to him because of the high costs of the agricultural supplies that he needs and the low sales price for his products. José says that his principal goal is to expand his production of milk, since he has a lot of available space to have more animals and thus be able to achieve a financial stability that will help him to offer a better future and well-being to his children and his wife.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows

loans.name: Babylyn

texts.en:
Babylyn is 39 and has four school-age children. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she runs a small variety store while her husband manages their small repair shop. She aims to improve her store and increase her product offerings, but her capital is not enough to run a business. 

For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more stock of soft drinks, gasoline, snack foods, assorted candies, beverages, and seasonings to sell. 

She believes that her loan will be a great help for her to improve her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, gasoline, snack foods, assorted candies, beverages and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Ruben Antonio,

texts.es: Ruben de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 10 y 4 años de edad, el se dedica a la elaboración de camarotes, roperos, gabeteros, etc. todo de madera, posee clientela fija ya que vende sus productos en los comercios que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Ruben esta solicitando un credito para la compra de los materiales necesarios como: madera, clavos, barniz, pintura, etc. para seguir elaborando dichos muebles y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ruben is 30 years old. He lives in his own home with his life's companion and their two children, aged 10 and 4. He works making bunk beds, wardrobes,  file cabinets, everything out of wood. He has regular customers because he sells his products in stores that are close to his residence. With what he earns from his sales he is able to pay for some household expenses. Ruben is asking for a loan to buy necessary materials such as wood, nails, varnish, paint, etc., to keep making the furniture and earning more profits to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, varnish, paint, etc.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
La Señora. María está realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito 26-71 y sus deseos son de superación y espera que todo le vaya muy bien y poder estrechar aún más sus lasos de amistad con cada una de sus integrantes. Vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que goza de paisajes inigualables, su centro histórico conserva su arquitectura al igual que su gente conserva su cultura y tradiciones.
La Señora María tiene 47 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 5 hijos, cuatro de ellos ya son mayores de edad, todos los solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su ultimo hijo de 11 años está estudiando en el colegio, su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que vive es arrendada.
Doña María se dedica a la venta ambulante de granos tiernos, negocio que le ha permitido mejorar la económica de su hogar, sus productos los vende de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. 
El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de más granos para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
María is taking out her first loan with her friends and companions from the 26-71 credit group. What she wants is to get ahead and she hopes that it goes very well for her and that she and the other members can become even better friends. She lives in the center of the city of Cuenca, a city that has unique scenery. Its historical center conserves its architecture while its people conserve their culture and traditions. 

María is 47 years old. She is in a common law marriage and has 5 children. Four of them are already grown. All of them are single and help her financially. Her youngest child is 11 and he is in school. Her husband works as a bricklayer. The house they live in is rented.

María works selling young grains as a street vendor. This business has allowed her to improve the household budget. She sells her products Sunday to Sunday with no set schedule. She is going to invest the money from the loan on buying more grains to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La Señora María forma parte  del grupo de crédito 26-71, se encuentra en este grupo desde hace 2 años tiempo en el que los créditos le han ayudado a crecer en su negocio. Vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que goza de paisajes inigualables, su centro histórico conserva su arquitectura al igual que su gente conserva su cultura y tradiciones.
La Señora María tiene 47 años de edad, vive en unión libre ha concebido 3 hijos de 20, 18 y 13 años de edad, su primer hijo tiene discapacidad pasa en casa, su segundo hijo estudia en la universidad y último hijo en el colegio, la casa en la que vive es arrendada, su esposo es de profesión chofer y presta sus servicios de forma privada.
Doña María labora a diario en su negocio el cual es la venta de productos toperware y también productos de medicina natural y cosméticos, le va bien en su negocio, este es un negocio que le da la oportunidad de cuidar de su familia y apoyar económicamente en su hogar. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compa de productos toperware y productos de medicina natural al igual que su crédito anterior. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
María is a part of the 26-71 credit group. She has been in this group for 2 years. During that time, the loans have helped her grow in her business. She lives in the center of the city of Cuenca, a city with unique scenery. Its historical center conserves its architecture and its people conserve their culture and traditions. 

María is 47 years old. She is in a common law marriage and has 3 children, aged 20, 18, and 13. Her oldest son is disabled and stays at home. Her second son is in college and her youngest son is in high school. The house she lives in is rented. Her husband is a driver by profession and works privately.  

María works every day in her business selling Tupperware and natural medicine products as well as cosmetics. The business is going well for her. It gives her an opportunity to care for her family and support her family financially. 

She will invest the money from the loan in buying Tupperware and natural medicine products, just like she did with the previous loan. Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy Tupperware and natural medicine products.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 41 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Marivic works very hard to provide for them.

Marivic runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for three years, and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, detergent soap, cereals, coffee, etc. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys, tiene 42 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo y uno de sus hijos, desde hace 10 años se dedica a vender ropa, lo hace de lunes  a sábado, es un oficio que aprendió de su madre.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar vestidos, blusas, camisas, pantalones, y faldas, en variedad de estilos, colores y tallas, lo que le servirá para aumentar el inventario de su negocio en las fiestas navideñas, espera obtener mejores ganancias para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Aspira con hacer crecer su negocio y tener una mejor economía.
texts.en:
Gladys, 42, is married.  She lives with her husband and one of her children.  She has sold clothing for 10 years.  She works Monday through Saturday.  She learned the business from her mother.

Gladys will use the loan to buy dresses, blouses, shirts, pants, and skirts in a variety of styles, colors, and sizes.  This will serve to increase her inventory for the Christmas holidays.

Gladys hopes to earn better profits to fulfill her obligations, to make her business grow, and to have better finances.

loans.use: to buy dresses, blouses, shirts, pants, and skirts

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara junto a sus hijos. Hace 12 años que decidió por establecer su propio negocio de pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica como lácteos, harina, manteca, refrescos, condimentos, azúcar, churros etc. Este préstamo que solicita es el quinto ciclo, y es por 15,000 lempiras para comprar más productos como granos básicos, carnes, quesos, refrescos, churros y otros para incrementar las ventas y la clientela. Tiene como meta crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Dina is 46 years old. She is a single mother who lives together with her children in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Twelve years ago she decided to open her own business selling basic grocery items such as dairy products, flour, butter, soft drinks, condiments, sugar, churros, etc.

Dina is in her fifth loan cycle. She is requesting a loan for 15,000 lempiras in order to buy products such as basic grains, meats, cheeses, soft drinks, churros (fried dough pastries), and other items to increase her sales and client-base. Her goal is to grow as a small business owner.

loans.use: to buy more products such as basic grains, meats, soft drinks, churros (fried dough pastries), and other items to sell.

loans.name: Elvine

texts.en: Elvine is 22 years old and married to Jeremiah. He is a businessman and she has been in business for six years. Right now her monthly income is 15,000 Kenyan shillings. She will use this loan to purchase a freezer and icebox for making more ice creams for sale. She will use her anticipated profit to expand her business. This is her first loan. Her hopes and dreams are to grow and introduce more business.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer and icebox for her ice cream business

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es: María, a sus 47 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo, al cual ha sacado adelante sola, pues nunca contó con el apoyo del padre de su hijo. Hace algunos años, comenzó a trabajar como empleada en un almacén de ropa pero, se le presentó la oportunidad de quedarse con el negocio, ya que el dueño tuvo que viajar inesperadamente y le propuso quedarse con él; así que, con ayuda de su padre logró comprar el negocio y desde entonces lleva 7 años en funcionamiento, trabaja sola todos los días de 8:00 am a 8:00 pm y, de esta manera ha logrado generar los recursos necesarios para solventar las necesidades de su hogar y para sacar adelante a su hijo. Solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (jeans, pantalones, camisas, camisetas, chaquetas, entre otros), así podrá abastecerse para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa con la llegada de la temporada decembrina y además cuando hay cosecha de café, pues hay más afluencia de personas y recolectores por el sector, permitiéndole aumentar sus ventas y los ingresos que éstas le generan. María sueña con tener un local propio, en el que pueda ampliar su negocio y generar mayor nivel de ventas y ganancias, para que le permita disfrutar de una estabilidad económica y mejor calidad de vida al lado de su hijo.
texts.en:
María is 47 years old. She is the single mother of one child who she has raised alone, as she never had the support of the father of her child. A few years ago she started to work as an employee in a clothing store. The opportunity came up to buy the business as the owner unexpectedly had to travel and proposed selling it to her. So with the help of her dad she managed to buy the business.

She has now been in business for 7 years. She works every day from 8 am to 8 pm. In this way she can generate the revenues needed to pay for the household expenses and get her child ahead.

María is requesting the help of a loan to invest in buying wholesale merchandise (jeans, pants, shirts, T-shirts, jackets, etc.). Then she can stock her business to meet the raising demand that comes with the Holiday season and then the coffee harvest. There are more people and coffee middleman in the area which will allow her to increase her sales and the income that this generates.

María dreams of having her own property where she can expand her business and generate more revenue and profit which would allow her to enjoy an economic stability and a better quality of living alongside her son.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale (jeans, pants, shorts, T-shirts, jackets, etc.).

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
Nelda works hard to support her family. Nelda is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Nelda requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like cooking oil, flour, eggs, spices, etc.

Nelda has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Nelda would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like cooking oil, flour, eggs, spices, etc

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna, 55, works hard to support her family.

She has been selling various kinds of fruit within her local community; she has been running this business for more than three years. 

To have continuous growth of her fruit vending business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. This loan will be used to buy bananas, apples, grapes, and longgans to sell.

She knows that this loan will enable her to keep her fruit vending business profitable.  In this way, she could save for the future of her six children.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, apples, grapes, and lonngans to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Elsie requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like snack foods, sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, shampoo, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Elsie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like snack foods, sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Elisa requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional goods to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Elisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ellen is 47 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Ellen has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business.

Ellen has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business.

loans.name: María Deyanira

texts.es: María, con 56 años de edad, es casada y madre de 6 hijos.
