Sandy es una joven de 24 años, es madre de un pequeño de 4 años de edad a quien quiere muchísimo y por el cual cada día Sandy trabaja muy duro para poder darle lo necesario para su crecimiento, ella saca adelante a su pequeño sola ya que el padre de su pequeño la abandono y desde ese momento es madre y padre para su hijo y afronta las dificultades con mucha valentía y mucho amor de madre. Día a día Sandy trabaja en su pequeño negocio de alquiler de ropa, ella trabaja a las afueras de un reclusorio ubicado a las afueras de su ciudad, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar con mucho esfuerzo.

Sandy está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le dan su apoyo y gracia a ello comprar materiales de construcción para poder construir una habitación en la vivienda donde habita y de esta manera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su pequeño ya que actualmente duerme en un cuartito de adobe, de esta manera Sandy podrá ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo, así Sandy seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Poder mejorar su negocio y darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Sandy is a young woman, 24 years old.  She is the mother of a little one, 4 years old, whom she loves so very much.  Sandy works very hard every day for her daughter, to be able to give her everything she needs to grow.  She gets by for her little one alone, because her daughter’s father abandoned her, and from that point on she has been mother and father to her child, facing difficulties with bravery and a mother’s love.  

Day by day, Sandy works at her small business, renting clothing.  She works outside a prison located in the suburbs of the city.  She works about eight hours a day, and with what she earns she covers the household expenses with great effort.

Sandy is very grateful to Kiva lenders because this is the second time they have given her their support.  Thanks to that support, she can buy construction materials to be able to build a room in the house where she lives so she can improve the quality of life of her little one, because currently she sleeps in a little adobe room.  In this way, Sandy will be able to offer a better quality of life to her child.  Sandy will keep fighting to be able to make her greatest dream come true: to be able to improve her business and give her child a good education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Hector Rolando

texts.es:
Hector, tiene 31 años actualmente se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Telecomunicaciones en la Universidad del Callao, su carrera consta de 5 años y se encuentra en el último año. 
El trabaja como técnico en Telecomunicaciones y paralelamente realiza sus prácticas pre-profesionales, dedica 42 horas semanales para sus estudios y se siente muy satisfecho y a la vez muy entusiasmado de poder estar logrando uno de sus más deseados sueños de convertirse en un profesional.
Su anhelo más grande es poder terminar su carrera satisfactoriamente, sacar su título universitario y hacer una especialización en Redes y Telecomunicaciones por eso que le pone muchas ganas de superación para así superar cualquier obstáculo que se le presente, el préstamo solicitado será utilizado para el pago completo de su especialización de su curso y así se pueda sentir tranquilo y  desenvolverse de manera más práctica.
Su meta a un futuro es poner su propia empresa de Telecomunicaciones y seguir con sus proyectos a largo plazo para poder sacar adelante a su familia.
Y a la vez agradece a las personas de Kiva por el apoyo que se le da y les gustaría que sigan apoyando a más personas que necesitan.
texts.en:
Hector, 31, is currently studying Telecommunications at the Universidad del Callao; he is in his last year of the 5 year degree.

He works as a a telecommunications technician while also carrying out his pre-proffesional training. He dedicates 42 hours per week to his studies and feels very pleased and is also very excited to be able to achieve one of his most desired dreams of becoming a professional. His greatest desire is to successfully finish his studies, receive his university degree and do a specialization in networks and telecommunications. This is why he puts so much effort into succeeding so that he can overcome any obstacle that he encounters. The loan that he is asking for will be used to pay in full the specialization of his course. With it paid, he will be able to continue in a calm and practical manner.

His future goal is to start his own telecommunications business and to continue with his projects for the long-term to be able to get his family ahead. 

At the same time he thanks Kiva lenders for their support, and encourages them to continue supporting the people who need it the most.

loans.use: to pay in full his course of specialization in Telecommunications.

loans.name: Madres Puntuales De San Juan Group

texts.es: Claudia de 36 años de edad, es separada y tiene 3 hijos de edades de 18, 17 y 14 años, de los cuales aún dependen de ella. Lleva 4 meses como cliente de Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de pollo brosther, salchipapas, hamburguesas. Comenzó por medio de la motivación de su mamá ya que ella le ayudaba cuando su mamá tenía negocio; ahora ella con la experiencia abrió su propio negocio como persona independiente después de 20 años. También tiene diferentes negocios como locutorio, internet y de videojuegos. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo, Claudia ha logrado darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Ella cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación, vestimenta y los pagos de servicios su hogar. Su plan para el futuro es poner una cadena de restaurantes y que siga creciendo sus demás negocios. Ella usa el préstamo para la compra de mercadería  en general como gaseosas, golosinas y demás. Claudia pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Madres puntuales de San Juan”, el cual está conformado por 7 personas y lleva el cargo de presidenta.
texts.en:
Claudia is 36 years old. She is separated and has 3 children still dependent on her aged 18, 17, and 14 years old. 

She has been a customer of Edaprospo for 4 months and she works selling broasted chicken, sausages and potatoes, and hamburgers. She was motivated to start through her mother as she always helped her when her mother had a business; and after 20 years of experience she has now opened her own business as an independent person.

She also has other businesses such as phone booths, internet and video games. Through her efforts and hard work Claudia has managed to give a better quality of life to her family. She covers the cost of food, education, clothing, and household expenses. 

Her plan for the future is to open a chain of restaurants and to continue growing her other businesses. She will use the loan for the purchase of general merchandise such as soft drinks, candy, and other items. Claudia belongs to the communal bank Madres Puntuales de San Juan which consists of 7 people and she serves as the president.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman and owns a house that has piped water, but not electricity.  Her greatest monthly expense is food and fees for her three kids.
 
She has operated a tailoring business for the past 4 years.  Her potential clients are both women and men.  She dreams of establishing a tailoring school in the future. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.  She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
This is Halima, a hardworking and enterprising woman.  

Her previous loan was a big help to her vegetable stall, thus enabling her get more income.

She also operates rental houses and she is requesting for a loan of ksh.50,000 to renovate rental houses.  She thanks Yehu and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to renovate rental houses

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey is aged 52 and a widowed mother of two kids, both of whom are her responsibility. Srey is  a borrower originally from the Prey Chhor district of Kompong Cham province. To struggle for a living for  her family, she has been working so hard on two hectares of paddy rice, a farm which she has been working for several years. This business currently returns her about 29,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first microloan for her entire group,  consisting of four borrowers who are requesting 1,000,000 KHR each with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader, Srey will spend her entire loan portion in order to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes to soon boost her crop yield so as she can gain better income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Heng is 64 years old and a widow with one child.  She is a resident from Moung Russey district in Battambong province. 

To make a living, she sells beans as her main business, which she has done for ages.  The main challenge for her business is the shortage of working capital to support her business.  Therefore, she applied for a new loan to overcome her challenge. 

This is the fourth loan for Heng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  The past loan which she has repaid completely has enabled her to alleviate her family’s burden. Now, she is seeking 600,000 KHR while her co-borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. 

As the leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy beans for resale. She hopes to gain increased income from her business so she can keep improving her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy beans for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover her son's tuition fees

loans.name: Sinorn

texts.en:
Sinorn is a 29-year-old mother with two kids who resides in Siem Reap province. To feed her family, she has been farming paddy rice and cassava for two years. 

Sinorn is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her cassava farm. This will be her first loan with the Kiva partner VisionFund. Sinorn hopes to earn more income from her cassava farming and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey is 34 years old and one of the breadwinners in her family which consists of three kids. To earn a living, she grows rice and works for others for a fee. Srey has done this for more than 10 years and is able to generate about 18,200 KHR per day. She has had a previous loan from the Kiva partner VisionFund.

Srey is the leader of a two-person group loan. She will use her portion of this new loan to buy grocery items to resell to start a new business. Srey hopes she will be able to earn a good income from her new business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and start a new business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mohamed Dayib

texts.en:
Mohamed Dayib is 23 years old. He studies at New Generation University College, faculty of Human Resource Management. His main challenge is the lack of a laptop, which he needs to prepare his assignments and read lessons when given in soft copy. 

Mohamed Dayib is requesting a loan from  Kaaba MFI, which he will use to purchase a laptop that he can pay for in installments.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis vive en la ciudad de Camaná, está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo, ya que Luis alquila eta movilidad para poder tener un ingreso mas ya que también poder comprar utensilios para su pequeño negocio de venta de jugos, asi el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y de esta manera seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:”tener un gran restaurante”.
texts.en:
Luis lives in the city of Camaná and is grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their support, he will be able to provide general maintenance to his vehicle. Luis rents out this vehicle so that he can have additional income. He will also buy utensils for his small juice business. This will allow him to improve his earnings.

Luis continues to strive toward fulfilling his greatest wish of having a large restaurant.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance and to buy utensils.

loans.name: Vielka Yajaira

texts.es:
Vielka es una mujer muy luchadora, sobre todo porque ha pasado muchas adversidades, entre ellas perder a 4 de sus hijos, pero a pesar del dolor ha sabido seguir adelante, tal es así que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado tener su negocio de venta de comida, desde hace 2 años, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas y cree que le va bien porque aun tiene 4 hijos por quien luchar.

Vielka esta agradecida con los prestamistas ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá realizar mejoras en el pequeño local donde tiene su negocio, Vielka podrá tarrajear las paredes, pintar la fachas, comprar mesas y sillas; así podrá ofrecer una mejor atención a sus clientes y luchar por hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener un gran restaurante”.
texts.en:
Vielka's a very determined woman, especially because she has gone through a lot of adversity, including losing four of her children.  Despite the pain, however, she has been able to go on.  As a result, with a lot of effort she has managed to run a business selling food for two years.  She works about nine hours and believes it's going well for her because she still has four children to fight for.

Vielka's grateful to the lenders because thanks to their support she'll be able to make improvements on the small space where she has her business.  She'll plaster the walls, paint, and buy tables and chairs.  This way she'll be able to offer better customer service and strive to achieve her big dream of having a great restaurant.

loans.use: to remodel her space and to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a divorced mother of three children.  They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years she has operated a food stall business, selling from her home to her neighbours and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business and dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is taking out another Kiva loan to expand her existing business. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase onions, potatoes, tomatoes, and vegetables to sell.

She is grateful for the opportunity given by Yehu Microfinance and Kiva lenders to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase onions, potatoes, tomatoes, and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, cooking fat and other products

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, Mai is 46 years old and a widowed mother of two children. Nowadays, one schoolchild still depends on her.  

For the sake of her family, Mai has been farming on two hectares of rice farm as the main source of income and supplements her family income via a pig-raising business. 

This is the second loan for Mai with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She has paid back her past loan already, which helped her to improve her living situation. As a borrower requesting a loan of 4,000,000KHR, Mai is going to use her entire loan to pay for harvesting and plowing fees for her business. She hopes to earn more income so as she can expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting and plowing fees for her business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Samon

texts.en:
Samon, 34, is a resident from Cherng Prey district of Kompong Cham province. To cover the daily food consumption in her household, Samon grows rice on 1.5 hectares of farmland and works as a paid worker to earn additional income. Now, she is able to earn up to 38,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

Samon, a second-time borrower with a successful repayment of her original loan that has supported her business in a timely way, is seeking a new loan of 3,000,000 KHR with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She will use her entire loan portion to pay for the harvesting fee and plowing fee for her agribusiness. She highly believes that she can timely plow her rice field so that she can make more income again.

loans.use: To pay for the harvesting fee and plowing fee for her agribusiness

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Chhoeurt's Group

texts.en:
Chhoeurt, aged 28, is a mother of one son.  She is a local borrower from Moung Russey district of Battambong province.  

To provide decent food for the family, Chhoeurt grows paddy rice and sells grocery items as her main source of income.  It is the business that she has been with since she was 20 years old.  Her current business earns her about 31,000 KHR per day. 

This is the third microloan for Chhoeurt and her joint borrower (in the same group of two) with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and they are asking again for the same loan amount of 500,000 KHR each. Her past loan, with successful repayments, has enabled her to maintain a good living condition for her family. Now, she is a group leader. 

She will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to plant her crop in at just the right time and get a double yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Nevys Johanna

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Nevys en su negocio de venta de ránchos, víveres de la canasta familiar en general, porque con su credikiva invertido en arroz, azucar, café, carnes frias, y verduras en general, incremntó sus inventarios y suplió en un 90% las necesidades de su clientela. Hoy con un mayor número de productos vendidos, pudo lograr mas utilidades y mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales. Ella agradece a los finaciadores de Kiva este hecho y pide que sigan apoyando a muchos microempresarios en el cumplimiento de sus sueños. En la actualidad está aplicando  auna nueva finaciación, mediante el cual comprará un mayor volumen de víveres, ranchos, refrescos, cárnicos etc, para tener muchos mas inventarios con los cuales responder la rápida rotación de las mercancias en la época decembrina, que es la comercialmente mas impactante para su negocio.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Nevys with her grocery store. She was able to buy rice, sugar, coffee, cold meats and vegetables with the loan, to increase her stock and to cover 90% of her clients' demand. Having increased her sales, she has also improved her quality of life. 

She is grateful to Kiva lenders for this and asks them to keep supporting microentrepreneurs to meet their goals. She is now applying for a new loan to be used in the purchase of food, communal meals, soft drinks, meat, etc. so that she can increase her stock and respond to the higher stock rotation in December, the most relevant time of year for her business.

loans.use: to buy a higher volume of food, communal meals, soft drinks, meat, etc.

loans.name: Kaniz's Group

texts.en: Kaniz is a 43-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly, and because of this, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Kaniz, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Kaniz is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 45-year-old poor lady. Suriya and her family are passing their lives in very miserable conditions. In fact, her husband did not adopt any profession constantly; he has been skipping professions from time to time for many years. A few months ago, he was doing a job as a laborer in a firm on very low wages. 

Now, he has decided to drive a rickshaw again. He already had an auto rickshaw of his own, but he was not driving it due to its damaged body. Suriya gave him a piece of advice that he should drive his own auto rickshaw, and this time, he has agreed to drive. Therefore, she is taking loan to encourage her husband, so that he can buy a new rickshaw body and drive the auto rickshaw again.
 
Suriya hopes that her husband will stabilize with this profession this time and drive an auto rickshaw for the long run. Suriya is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an auto rickshaw body.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Phann

texts.en:
Phann is 23 years old and an experienced farmer from a remote area of the Moung Ruessei district in Battambang province. She is single and lives with her parents and five other siblings. Phann has been a farmer since she was a young girl. She has learned to work in the agriculture sector, which is a family traditional business and the major source of her family’s income, from her parents. 

In order to be able to gain access to water and sanitation, Phan is asking for a loan to buy materials needed to build a household latrine and pay for labor costs, thanks to the water-loan program offered by HKL with a special rate. It has helped to encourage Phann to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to build a household latrine and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Zavkibek

texts.en:
Zavkibek was born in 1982.  He is hardworking man.  Zavkibek is married and has 3 children. 

He is a master of car repair.  Zavkibek has been working in this business more than 8 years.  He has a car which is necessary for his business.  Now, his car is broken and he must to repair it.  Zavkibek is asking for a loan of 700 USD to repair his car.  He awaits your support.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Tang

texts.en:
Tang is an experienced farmer from Preah Chambak village in the Bakan district in Pursat province. She is 26 years old and lives with her husband and their small child. Tang and her husband help each other manage their farming business. They work cultivating rice and other seasonal crops to improve their economic situation. Tang sells the products in the local market, which is an important source of the family’s income. 

Tang is requesting a loan to build a safe latrine at their house to improve their health and also to build a water storage unit to ensure enough water for her family’s daily consumption. This will be her second loan. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL with a special rate, Tang has been able to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a safe latrine and a water storage unit to improve her family's health

loans.name: Luz Y Vida  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Luz y Vida está formado por 7 socias y 1 socio quienes viven por el sector de Monay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, esta bañada por 4 ríos los mismos que le dan un toque especial, su geografía accidentada regala mágicos paisajes. Su gente se caracteriza por ser amable y gentil, que realizan sus mejores esfuerzos para sacar adelante a sus familias, aún mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, los mismos que fueron inculcados por sus padres.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Zoila Cecilia, es una socia activa desde hace 10 años, en todo este tiempo ha llegado a tener una muy buena amistad con todas las socias que forman parte del grupo y los créditos le han permitido mejorar su situación económica.
Doña Zoila Cecilia tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos, uno de sus hijos ya es casado y vive independiente, su segundo hijo estudia en la universidad y su ultimo hijo estudia en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo labora colocando cielos rasos, la casa en la que vive es propia.
La Señora Zoila Cecilia desde hace algunos años tiene un negocio familia que le ayuda a mejorar la situación económica, con su esposo se dedican a colocar cielos rasos, laboran de domingo a domingo sin un horario, ella se dedica también a la crianza de gallinas, cuyes y cerdos. 
El dinero de su crédito a invertir en la compra de aluminio, yeso y pintura para el negocio. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The “Luz y Vida” loan group is made up of 7 ladies and one gentleman who live in the Monay area of the city of Cuenca.  This city is bathed by four rivers, which provide a special touch, along with its accidental geography and majestic landscapes.  This city has been a World Heritage Site since 1999 and its people are known for being friendly and gentle and make their best effort to get ahead with their families.  They also maintain the culture and traditions created by their forefathers.

Zoila Cecilia is one of the members.  She has been active for ten years and has gotten to be very good friends with all the members of this group and the loans have helped her improve her financial situation.

She is 47 years old, married, and has three children; one of her sons is married and on his own.  Her next oldest studies at university and the youngest attends the local school. Her husband works in real estate and they own their home.

Zoila Cecilia has had a family business for several years and it helps with the financial situation.  She also works in real estate with her husband and they work seven days a week without a set schedule.  She also raises chickens, Guinea pigs, and pigs.

She will use the money from this loan to buy aluminum, plaster, and paint for her business.  Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Carren

texts.en:
Carren operates a retail shop to earn a living and support her family. She used a previous loan to help buy food products for her business. 

Carren is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy maize flour, rice, cooking oil, milk, and sugar for her business. She appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu at large.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, rice, cooking oil, milk, and sugar for her business

loans.name: Manos Al Fuego Group

texts.es: Sara, quien aparece como la quinta persona de derecha a izquierda y de rosado, es socia del Banco Comunal Manos al Fuego en donde sus socios tienen negocios tales como la venta de ropa usada y nueva, arriendo de loza para eventos, venta de perfumes. El negocio de Sara es de repostería y amasandería, el cual comenzó hace unos 10 años y fue solo por querer ayudar en su Iglesia que comenzó a vender queques y completos, como se dio cuenta que le iba muy bien comenzó a vender para tener más dinero y fue como se empezó a colocar metas como el querer tener un horno más grande y una sobadora, los que son sus nuevos proyectos. Con el dinero que está solicitando podrá comprar moldes que necesita e insumos como azúcar, harina, chocolate, mermeladas. Lo que más le ha gustado de poder trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de encontrar más gente con las mismas ganas de salir adelante que ella ha demostrado y además de poder generar redes que la ayuden a llegar a sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Sara, who appears as the fifth person from the right and left, dressed in pink, is a member of the Manos al Fuego communal bank.  The members have businesses such as selling new and used clothing, renting tableware for events, and selling perfumes. 

Sara’s business is a bakery and pastry shop.  She began it some ten years ago.  It was only due to wanting to help in her church that she began to sell cakes and completos (Chilean hot dogs with lots of toppings).  When she realized that it was going really well for her, she started to make sales to earn more money.  She started to set herself goals, such as getting a bigger oven and a pastry rolling machine, which are her new projects.

With the money that she is asking for, she will be able to buy molds that she needs and supplies such as sugar, flour, chocolate and jellies.  What she has liked most about working with Fondo Esperanza is getting to know more people with the same desire to get ahead that she has shown and forming networks with them to help reach her goals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and molds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Alejandra Camila

texts.es:
Alejandra es una joven de 22 años, la cual trabaja como empleada en un centro fotográfico de su ciudad y también con mucho esfuerzo tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, con el cual tiene un dinero extra para sus gastos; Alejandra cree que le esta yendo bien porque es responsable.

Alejandra esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá comprar ropa como polos, short, faldas, entre otros; sobre todo porque es temporada navideña y con ello podrá mejorar sus ingresos, así ella seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” “Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a young woman who is 22 years of age. She works as an employee at a photography center in the city. In addition, with great effort, she has her own business of selling clothes. This enables her to have extra income for her expenses. Alejandra believes she is doing well because she is responsible.

She is grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, Alejandra will be able to buy clothes such as polo shirts, shorts, skirts, and other items for the Christmas season. This will enable her to improve her earnings. She continues to strive toward fulfilling her greatest wish of having a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts, shorts, skirts, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora is a married woman and lives with her husband and children.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operates a charcoal selling business. She sells out of her home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to become a wholesale supplier of charcoal in the village. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives in the coastal region . 

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop  business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Silvianah

texts.en:
Silvianah lives in the Coastal region of Kenya. She has operated a clothes selling business for the past two years. She sells clothes to her town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces the major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Blanca Esmeralda

texts.es: Doña Blanca,  tiene 56 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de Intibucá junto a su hijo.  Hace 3 años que estableció su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica como pan, leche, embutidos, verduras, churros, manteca, arroz, azúcar, harina, jabón etc. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la elaboración y venta de  pan y tamales. Ha solicitado un tercer préstamo a la institución que es por 11,000 lempiras, con el cual va surtir de productos como granos básicos, lácteos, embutidos, churros, refrescos, y otros abarrotes para poder incrementar las ventas. Tiene como meta  trabajar arduamente y ver crecer más el negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Blanca is 56 years old, married, and has one child. She and her son live in the town of Intibucá. Three years ago, she established her own grocery business where she sells basic household products such as bread, milk, sausages, vegetables, snack foods, lard, rice, sugar, flour, soap, and other items. She previously made and sold bread and tamales.

Blanca is requesting her third loan from ODEF in the amount of 11,000 HNL. She will use the money to restock her business with products such as basic grains, dairy goods, sausages, snack foods, soft drinks, and other groceries so that she can increase her sales. Her goals are to work hard and to grow her business even more.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy goods, sausages, snack foods, soft drinks, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy four boxes of starters for vehicles.

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en:
Savorn is a young, 20-year-old mother who is blessed with two daughters. She is residing in Dambae district in Kompong Cham province. To earn a living, she grows cassava on 3 hectares of farmland; it is the business which she has been involved with for five years, earning about 35,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

This is not the original loan for Savorn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past three loans, which she has repaid with success, have helped her to stabilize her living conditions at a gradual pace. Now, she is seeking a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR in order to pay for the labor fee to slash-and-burn her farm to grow more cassava, and to buy insecticide for her crop. She hopes to gain more crop yield with a high selling price so she can live in a better condition.

loans.use: To pay for the labor fee to slash-and-burn her farm to grow more cassava

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom is 30-years-old and a villager from the Kandal Steung district of Kandal province.  She is a mother of four children.  All of them are under her responsibility and they are in school.  To cover the necessary needs in her family, she and her husband farm rice as the main source of their income and she supplements her family's income via a salary from working at a local factory.  Currently, she is able to earn up to 21,800 KHR per day.  For this cycle, she teamed up with a first micro loan group consisting of six borrowers requesting a new loan of 177,000 KHR each with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). For Mom, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family.  She hopes to improve the sanitation practices in her family.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family

loans.name: Tharong's Group

texts.en:
Tharong is 29 years old and a mother one daughter who is still in school. She is a resident from Prey Chhor district of Kompong Cham province. To feed her family, she is a rice farmer and works as a paid worker to supplement her income. She has been involved in this business for 10 years, earning about 40,000 KHR per day. 

This is not the first loan for Tharong with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She repaid her past loan completely. It helped her to improve her living standard especially to buy household appliances and to keep her children in school. Now, she has formed a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay for a labor fee, a reaping fee, and a land leasing fee. She hopes that she can increase her yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay a labor fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 37-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband, 2 daughters, and 2 sons in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Since 2006, her husband has had a general store and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. His wife, Shazia, has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan. 

Shazia requested a loan to buy appliances for the house.  With the loan money, she can take care of the household requirements necessary to maintain his home as well as possible for a normal life and also to help her husband save for the better future of his children.

Shazia and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be lucky and productive for their family.

loans.use: To pay for appliances for the house.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 33-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, her son and three daughters. For 15 years, her husband has run a scrap shop which is the only source of income for their family. Shehnaz’s sons are very hardworking and help their father in his business a lot. 

Shehnaz is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband purchase a shop for their son. Her loan will help her family to improve their income. Shehnaz hopes that her husband will be able to continue his business and that her son will be successful.

loans.use: to start a shop for her son

loans.name: Seema

texts.en:
Seema is a 55-year-old widow who is the mother of eight children. Her son recently started an electronics shop after his father died and he sells electronics, tubes, rods, switches, copper wires, and various brands of energy-saver bulbs. He also provides troubleshooting services. 

Seema is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to buy stock for her son’s store. He wants to provide increased income for his family. This will be Seema’s second loan with BRAC and she hopes that her son will be able to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods to sell

loans.name: Kimyan

texts.en:
Kimyan is 37 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. To earn a living, her husband is a security guard and a construction worker when he is free. He makes an income of $7 per day. 

Due to lack of funds, Kimyan is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase a plot of land. This purchase will help her obtain a good place to build a house. In addition, she will run a food store at her house to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land for building a house.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia tiene 45 años de edad vive junto a su familia en el distrito de La Matanza, es una comunidad tranquila que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida y cerveza en su domicilio desde hace cinco años, cuenta con cliente la considerable, es conocida por la buena sazón de sus platos que ofrece, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de sacos de maíz y azúcar para la elaboración de chicha de jora y así ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Aurelia, 45, lives with her family in the La Matanza district two hours from the city of Piura, on the northern coast of Peru.  It's a peaceful community devoted to agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

Aurelia has worked selling food and beer in her home for five years.  She has a lot of customers and is known for the good taste of the dishes she serves.

She has requested a loan for 2,500 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy sacks of corn and sugar to make "chicha de jora" [corn beer] to sell to her customers and earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn and sugar to make corn beer

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is 49 years of age and married with four children. She has been selling vegetables and bananas for more than three years. Due to financial constraints, she is requesting a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) to buy a variety of seeds to plant and a volume of bananas. Sonia expects to further increase her earnings with her loan to earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy a variety of seeds to plant and a volume of bananas.

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
To support her family, Noralyn plants a variety of vegetables and then harvests for selling, while her husband is in a transportation business. She believes that much patience is needed in operating these sources of income for earning funds. 

She is in need of more capital, and that’s why she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy vegetables such as bitter gourd, eggplant and squash, and also to pay for maintenance of their motorcycle. 

Noralyn hopes that her loan request will be granted so that she can improve and expand her business to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as bitter gourd, eggplant and squash and also to pay for maintenance of their motorcycle.

loans.name: Segundo Victor

texts.es:
Segundo Víctor tiene 66 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de La Compuerta, una zona rural de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de animales de corral patos, pollos, cuyes, en su domicilio, con muchos años de experiencia en el negocio, además se dedica a las labores agrícolas en la misma zona.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de alimentos balanceados y una segunda parte en la compra de cerdos para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Víctor is 66 years old and lives with his wife and children in the hamlet of la Compuerta, a rural area of Oyotún, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru. The locals work in agriculture, livestock and commerce.

Segundo Victor makes a living raising farm animals such as ducks, chickens and guinea pigs at his home. He has many years' experience in the business and also does agricultural work in the same area.

He has asked for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy balanced feed and also to buy pigs which he then fattens and sells to his customers for more money, thus generating an income for his family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and buy pigs.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 50 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Gilda has a general store business in the Philippines. Gilda requested a 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Gilda has been in this business for four years. In the future, Gilda would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Matilde Leonor

texts.es:
Matilde Leonor tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Mocupe una comunidad tranquila, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de cuyes, desde hace 2 años en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y una segunda parte para la compra de cerdos para posteriormente de engordarlos ofrecerlos a sus clientes, genrando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Matilde Leonor is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and children in Mocupe, a peaceful community where people work in agriculture, commerce and livestock. It is located an hour away from Chiclayo, in Peru’s northern coast.

Matilde raises and sells guinea pigs. She has been doing this for two years in her backyard. She has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy animal feed and also to buy pigs to fatten and sell them to her customers, with the intention to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and pigs.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is 28-year-old married man. He lives in a small village of the Gurjaani district with his wife and three children. Mamuka is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a vineyard and sells grapes. 

As the income is only seasonal, Mamuka decided to start his own and more stable business, and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $3,000 to start a trading business. 

With the received credit he will purchase cattle and then resell at a higher price. This will increase the income of his family, and with increased income he will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to begin trade with cattle.

loans.name: Albert's Group

texts.en:
Albert's Group is a group of six group leader farmers in Webuye District with Albert selected as the Kiva representative.  Albert has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 61 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.						

Albert is married and has 11 children.  He is 58 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer.  He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group, the savings group, the prayer group and the burial committee.  Albert has been a farmer for 20 years.  He described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  		

He first joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, new farming methods, fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and to earn enough to feed his family and send their children to school.  As an active member in his community, Albert also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes leading. He also wants to help more farmers in his community and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  

Albert plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow and invest in a business.  His life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because he has more profits from harvest, more of farm training, more farm group support, and is able to save money and feed the family.							

Albert and the Alpha Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.			

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Muna Ahmed

texts.en:
Muna Ahmed is 20 years old. She is a secondary school student. She wants to start at university after she finishes at her school. She needs a laptop, and she requested that Kaaba give her the laptop as a loan; then, she will pay installments. Now she is waiting for the laptop. 

Kaaba will provide the laptop to Muna as a loan, and she will pay monthly repayments. After school, Muna hopes to learn business and to work in admin and finance.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Daysi Anabell

texts.es: Daysi de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, ella posee un negocio de venta de productos lácteos, embutidos y productos desechables, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la calidad de sus productos y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Daysi esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder atender mejor a sus clientes y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener junto con su madre una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Daysi is 42 years old and lives in a home of her own with her mother.  She has a business where she sells dairy products, sausages, and disposable items.  Her business is located in the local market near her home and she has many customers because of the quality of her products and their good prices.  Daysi is asking for a loan to buy more products so she can better serve her customers and be able to obtain greater earnings so she and her mother can have better financial stability.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria Laura

texts.es: Doña Maria de 54 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su hija quien trabaja y le ayuda en los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años, lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela, Doña Maria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa por mayor para poder seguir con su trabajo y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias para darle tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su hija sin limitaciones alguna.
texts.en: Maria is 54 years old and lives in her family’s home with her daughter who works and helps with the household expenses.  She has been selling clothing on foot for several years in the various neighborhoods near her home.  Maria is asking for a loan to buy clothing in quantity, so she can continue her work and be able to obtain greater income so she can provide herself and her daughter with better financial stability without limits.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: La Esperanza Del Futuro Group

texts.es: Flor, quien aparece sentada de las segundas de izquierda a derecha, pertenece al Banco Comunal La Esperanza del Futuro, de Cañete. En este Bancos sus socios tienen variados negocios tales como peluquería costuras, venta de cosméticos, y venta de géneros. Flor vende pan amasado, tortillas, murtillas, nalcas, harina tostada y de avellana pero su fuerte es la venta de mote con huesillo, el cual vende en un puesto que tiene en feria y también casa por casa, el cuál comenzó hace 30 años aproximadamente para poder ir en ayuda de sus hijos; todos los manjares que hace se los enseño su madre quién también vendía. Uno de sus sueños es poder seguir adelante y sacar adelante a su nieto, del cual ella se hace cargo y también aprender a leer, además de que pronto quiere agregar también la venta de zapatillas a su puesto en la feria. El dinero que está solicitando lo ocupará para comprar insumos como azúcar, cucharas, vasos plásticos, huesillos, un Cooler, quitasol y mesa plegable. Le ha ido bien con la venta de sus productos. Y cuenta que los que más le gustado de trabajar junto a fondo esperanza es la ayuda con el dinero que le otorgan.
texts.en:
Flor, who is the second woman sitting starting from the left, is a member of the Communal Bank La Esperanza del Futuro, in Cañete. Its members run different businesses, including hairdresser, dressmaking, cosmetic sale and fabric sale. Flor sells dough, tortillas, murtillas (the fruit of the myrtle), nalca (an edible plant), toasted flour and hazelnut flour, but her best selling item is "mote con huesillo" (traditional Chilean summer-time non-alcoholic drink made from wheat and peaches), which she sells in a street stand or going door-to-door. She started in this business approximately 30 years ago with an aim to support her children. She learned to cook from her mother, who also worked selling food. 

One of her dreams is to get ahead and support her grandson, who is under her responsibility. She also wants to learn how to read and would like to start selling slippers in her stand. 

She will use the loan to buy supplies, such as sugar, spoons, plastic cups, sun-dried peaches, a cooler, sunshade and a folding table. Things have gone well with her business so far and she says that what she likes the most of working with La Esperanza is the financial support they receive.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as sugar, sun-dried peaches, cups, spoons, a folding table, a cooler and sunshade.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Tha works hard to secure the overall welfare of her family. She is 34 years old and a business-minded woman who is dedicated to a farming business in Pursat province. Her dream is to continue working in order to help her children going to school. Tha has been working in farming for more than 15 years.

Tha has been a client with HKL for the previous loan, which positively impacted her family. As this is her second loan, she aims to build a safe latrine at home to keep them healthier. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL with a special rate, Tha is able to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a safe latrine at home to keep them healthier.

loans.name: Sochea

texts.en:
Sochea, aged 35, is a hard-working mother and supportive wife to her husband in managing their rice farming business, which is located in the Bakan district of Pursat province. Sochea and her spouse aim to continue working to obtain better yield throughout the harvest season and be able to educate their two children. Having been in the business for nearly 15 years, she is able to earn a daily income of $7.00 per day.

Currently Sochea’s family has an unhygienic latrine at home, so she wants to build a safe one to improve adequate sanitation for the household. For this particular reason, she has requested a loan of $500 to buy materials needed and pay for labor costs in performing the construction. She thanks the water loan program, offered by HKL with a special interest rate, which has encouraged her to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a safe latrine to improve adequate sanitation for the household.

loans.name: Naimakhon

texts.en: Naimakhon was born in 1976. She is married and has three children.  Naimakhon has a higher degree.  She is a teacher.  She works in a school.  Naimakhon teaches Tajik literature and language.  She has worked more than 14 years.  She is one of the best teachers.  Her husband is a migrant worker and doesn’t send enough money.  Naimakhon wants to repair her house but she has no money.  Naimakhon is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy building materials. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair her house

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 30-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as a determined person. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services.

She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a conducive environment with good potential and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. 

She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy cosmetics and other beauty products for use in beauty salon.  Her business goal is to open more beauty salons in other towns within 5 years.  She hopes this will result in maximized profits and will improve her living standards.  This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy cosmetics and other beauty products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with one child who attends school. She operates a vegetable business, selling from her home to neighbors and passersby. Halima faces stiff competition from other vegetable vendors in her area. She owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expense is school fees. Halima decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Halima is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables to resell.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes appreciates the support of the previous loan which helped her to buy utensils to sell. She earned income which helped her to grow her business and support her family as well. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to buy more frying pans, plates, spoons and mugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy more frying pans, plates, spoons and mugs to sell.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en: Kwekwe appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a new loan of KES 20,000 to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids, who attend school. She lives in her own house that has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operates a fish selling business, which has been operational for over 1 year. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business, but dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school and one who is underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over two years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Mazera

texts.en:
This is Mazera. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more shop items. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. 

She would like to apply for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit.

Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria used the previous loan you gave her for her pub business. Her business improved and she was able to open a cereals business. Now she seeks a loan to buy cereals to sell. Her long term goal is to start selling clothes and be able to open her own boutique. The extra income that she will raise from the business will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat to sell in his butcher shop

loans.name: Sert's Group

texts.en:
Sert, 29, lives with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To make a living, Sert has been farming rice and planting pineapple for almost 10 years, earning about 60,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sert has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She completely paid back the past loans with VisionFund to improve her family’s livelihood and keep her children in school. As the leader, she is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her family’s business. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to generate more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her family’s business.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Sophal is 49 years old. She lives with her husband and one son in a rural village of the Dambae district. Rice farming, growing cassava and cashew are the main source of her family’s income. She has been in this business for about fifteen years. The current business earns her family a daily income of about 30,000 KHR and she is able to save 15,000 KHR each day. 

This is the first loan for Sophal with VisionFund. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay for labor fees in growing cassava. She hopes to grow more crops from her agribusiness to make a living better.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees in growing cassava.

loans.name: Koyny

texts.en: Koyny is a 23-year-old single woman residing in a rural village of Lerk Dek district of Kandal province. She deals with her daily cost of living via her occupation as government worker in the area. Koyny is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is now seeking an education loan to cover a tuition fee for her study at the university, where she is majoring in Law. She hopes that she can continue her studies and timely cover the cost of her studies.

loans.use: to cover a tuition fee of her studies.

loans.name: Hor's Group

texts.en:
Hor is aged 42 and married. He lives in a rural area of the Mounkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. He is a rice farmer who grows rice on 2 hectares of farmland while his wife is a paid worker. The current business earns him about 28,000KHR per day but he can manage to save about 8,000KHR each day after daily expenses.

Hor is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now he is leading his group to ask for a loan. Hor is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to earn more from his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Vanhoern's Group

texts.en:
Vanhoern, 28, is married and lives with her husband and one daughter in a village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She and her husband are rice farmers and they supplement their family’s income through working for others for a fee. Engaging in this business for 8 years, she is able to earn about 54,000 KHR per day to support her family. 

Vanhoern has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She has successfully paid back the past loans, which have helped her family relieve financial burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay for labor to harvest her rice field. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield and earn more income to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for labor to harvest her rice field.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 40-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband, a daughter, and a son in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Since 2012, her husband has been running a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. As there has been a sharp increase in the cost of everything, he needs additional capital for the growth of his business. His wife, Rukhsana, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan.  With the loan money, her husband can buy a variety of goods for his general store to satisfy his clients more professionally as well as to increase his savings for the better future of his children.

Rukhsana and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: to pay for goods for general store

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en:
Rom is aged 55 and married with one son, who is still in school. Her family lives in a village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kadal province and she and her husband earn a living through farming rice and sometimes her husband works for others for a fee.  Having been in this business 20 years, she is able to earn about KHR 18,000 per day to meet the family’s need. 

Rom has been with VisionFund for one cycle. The past loan has helped her family relieve its financial burden to a great extent. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan.  As the leader, she is going to use her portion to renovate her old house.  She hopes to have a big house to live in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es:
Marìa Fernanda una mujer emprendedora que lucha por conseguir sus ideales, Crece en una familia conformada por la mamá quien luchó con empeño y dedicación por brindarle siempre desde casa excelentes principios y una buena educación, pues el padre renunció a ella cuando supo del embarazo existente. Desde entonces ha sido la madre un apoyo incondicional junto a la hermanastra menor, para no desfallecer y que cada día sea un nuevo comienzo con méritos hacia el éxito. 
A los 10 años Marìa Fernanda, en la mudanza de los dientes temporales a permanentes sufre un poco puesto que no fue algo convencional, los dientes eran más pequeños y tuvieron que colocar coronas poco estéticas, generando  burla por un lapso dentro del colegio y familia; este suceso conlleva a un “sueño”, por el cual se está luchando continuamente, a tal punto de tomar la decisión de estudiar en el área de la salud, emprendiendo la carrera de odontología  con el fin de hacer personas felices, que pasaron por problemas, traumas de infancia como en algún momento ella lo tuvo o simplemente por salud o apariencia sonrían con orgullo y le propaguen nuevo hábito para la sociedad.

En el año 2009 culmina los estudios secundarios y en pro de su sueño, se presenta a la Universidad, fallando en el intento, pero con esperanza ingresa a otra Universidad para empezar con su carrera profesional. Allí estudia hasta quinto semestre, pero una vez más el sueño se ve interrumpido, en esta ocasión por motivos económicos. Es una joven que demuestra compromiso, perseverancia y amor por el sueño que tuvo una vez de niña, que ahora es la profesión y el mayor anhelo, pues está segura que es la vocación y lo lleva en la sangre, por el cual no ha descansado y luchara hasta conseguirlo. Es  por ello que toma la decisión de quizá dar un paso atrás y retomar los estudios en la misma rama, pero ahora técnico, pues aún no hay una estabilidad económica la cual le brinde seguridad para continuar con los estudios universitarios.
Actualmente estudia en Campoalto salud oral en horas de la mañana de lunes a viernes, y por el desequilibrio económico ya antes mencionado, necesita del convenio con Kiva; donde espera seguir dando pasos firmes para continuar con los ideales, pues este es un paso para una solidez en el ámbito económico y así poder culminar los estudios universitarios; aportando  el conocimiento para el bienestar de muchos  que como maría Fernanda  busca sonreír frente a la vida pese a las dificultades que se presentan en el camino que inoportunamente son propias de la vida.
texts.en:
María Fernanda is a very enterprising woman who works hard to accomplish her ideals. She grew up in a family composed of a mother who struggled with a lot of effort and dedication to always give her excellent principles and a good education at home as María's father left her mother when he found out that she was pregnant. Since then, her mother has been of an unconditional support together with her younger stepsister, to not lose hope, and so that each day is a new beginning with all the virtues to achieving success.

When María Fernanda was 10 years old and her milk teeth were replaced with adult ones she suffered a bit as it wasn't something typical; her adult teeth were smaller and crowns that were not very aesthetic had to be put in place, making her the mockery of the school and family for a little while. This experience led to a ‘dream’, for which she is continually fighting. A dream to such an extent that she decided to pursue studies in healthcare, dentistry in particular, in order to make people happy, whether they had problems, childhood traumas as she had at one time, or simply for health or cosmetic reasons so that they could smile with pride and that they could have a new look in society.

In 2009, María Fernanda completed her secondary school studies, and to make her dream a reality, she applied to university, failing on that attempt but with optimism she entered another university to start her professional career. At this university she studied up to the 5th semester, but once again her dream was interrupted, this time round for financial reasons. 

She is a young woman who is proof of the compromise, perseverance and love for the dream that she had as a child, a dream that is now the profession and her greatest desire. She is sure that it is a vocation that is in her blood, hence why she has never tired and will continue to chase after the dream until she has made it a reality. It is for this reason that she decided to take a step back and resume her studies in the same branch but now from a technical aspect as she still does not have the financial stability with which to continue university studies.

María Fernanda is currently studying at Campoalto, Oral Care, in the morning from Monday to Friday and due to the aforementioned financial instability she needs the support of Kiva, where she hopes to continue making firm steps to realizing her dream. As this is a step towards financial security that will enable her to finish her university studies, obtaining knowledge for the wellbeing of many, such as María Fernanda, who look to smile at life despite the untimely difficulties presented along the way which are inherent to life.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of enrollment.

loans.name: Soka's Group

texts.en:
Sokha, aged 40 years old, is married and has four children, living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. All of her children are still in school. She and her husband earn a living through planting and selling rice and Chinese noodles. Also, sometimes her husband works for others for a fee. Together, they can earn about 85,000KHR per day from the current business and manage to save about 30,000KHR each day after offsetting expenses.

Soka has been with VisionFund for four cycles. The past loans that she successfully paid back have helped her family support the business and improve their living conditions. Now leading this group to apply for a loan, Sokha, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy more ingredients for making rice soup and Chinese noodle. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for making rice soup and Chinese noodle.

loans.name: Yasmeen Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 46-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband, two daughters and three sons in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Since 2010, she has been running a business selling bed sheets and she works very hard to meet her family's needs.  Yasmeen needs additional capital for the growth of her business. She is a member of a three-person lending group, and she has requested a loan from KIVA partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

With the loan money, she can buy more variety of bed sheets for her business to satisfy her clients more professionally, as well as increase her savings for the better future of her children.

Yasmeen and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: To buy more variety of bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Kimhuoy

texts.en:
Kimhuoy is 46 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $4 daily. 

To improve her family’s finances, Kimhuoy is requesting a loan of $1,300 to purchase silk thread for weaving. This money will help her acquire the ability to run an additional business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase silk thread for weaving.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is 31 years old from Olkalou. He is married to Merceline, who assists him in the farm, and they are blessed with three children, 7, 5 and 2 years old.

He is a farmer who  practices mixed farming, a business he has been running for the last five years. 

Antony sees that is family spends a lot of time going to fetch water, and that time could otherwise be used to do farm work. He has decided to apply for his fourth loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd., which will be used to buy a water storage tank.

His monthly income right now is KES 15,000 and he intends to use profits realized from his improved business to pay his loan back to KADET Ltd. and to expand his farming activities. In the future, he hopes to be an established and successful farmer.

loans.use: To buy a water storage tank for his family so that time spent going to fetch water can be used on the farm.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Hortencia tiene 45 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Morropon, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la elaboración de esencia de café, producto que entrega a las cafeterías de la zonas, también se desempeña como promotora de salud en la Municipalidad de la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de de una café materia prima de su negocio y una tostadora que le facilitara su negocio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Hortencia is 45 years old and lives with her family in the district of Morropón, two hours from Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru. The locals work in agriculture, livestock and commerce.

Hortencia earns a living making coffee essence which she then sells to cafés in the area. She also works as a health promoter for the local Council. 

She has asked for a loan of 500 nuevos soles to buy coffee, which is the raw material for her business, and a roaster which will help her in her business so she can earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy coffee and a roaster.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra is wonderful 44 year old woman. She is married and has 4 children. Gulchehra has been involved with animal husbandry for more than 10 years because she needed the money. 

Animal husbandry is the only source of income for the family. Her husband is ill and does not work. Gulchehra works hard from early morning until late at night. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. 

Her daughter is going to be married and Gulchehra does not have money for the wedding. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to provide a wedding party for her daughter. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to provide a wedding party of her daughter.

loans.name: Kanykey

texts.ru: Каныкей 30 лет, замужем, в данное время одна воспитывает 4 детей, так как супруг находится на заработках в России. Ежемесячно супруг высылает большую часть своей зарплаты семье в Кыргызстан. Дочерям Каныкей 11 и 9 лет-школьницы, сыновья- Саматбек и Самарбек дошкольного возраста. Сама Каныкей по характеру очень трудолюбивая, целеустремленная и просто заботливая мать. Каныкей пытается внести свой вклад в развитие благоустройства своей семьи, поэтому она не сидит сложа руки, а занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад с 14,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Каныкей, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день в активах имеется: 1 дойная корова и 1 теленок, а также 0,13 ГА земельной доли, на которой выращивает кукурузу, картошку, овощи. У Каныкей и ее семьи очень большой опыт в животноводстве и полеводстве. Ежемесячный доход составляет 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Каныкей обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Каныкей планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также в будущем намерена построить новое помещение для скота.
texts.en:
Kanykey is 30 years old, married, and is currently supporting four children since her husband is working abroad in Russia. Every month, her husband sends most of his salary to the family in Kyrgyzstan. Kanykey's daughters are in school, aged 11 and 9 years old, and her sons Samatbek and Samarbek are of preschool age. Kanykey herself by character is very hardworking, purposeful and a simply loving mother. Kanykey tries to contribute her part to the development of her family's well-being, therefore she does not sit idly by, and is engaged in agriculture and livestock, having started 10 years ago with 14,000 som KGS.

Thanks to her hard work, Kanykey currently has in assets on her homestead: one dairy cow and one calf, and also has 0.13-hectare plot of land, on which she grows corn, potatoes, and vegetables. Kanykey and his family have quite a lot of experience in raising livestock and growing crops. Monthly income consist of 4,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Kanykey turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy cows for fattening and subsequent sale at the market at a high price.

Kanykey plans to invest income from the loan to further propagate the quantity of domestic animals, and also in the future intends to build a new building for the livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. Gina is married and has a bicycle-transport business in the Philippines.

Gina requested a 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy another bicycle for her business.
