texts.en: This is Dena. He is thankful for his previous loan that improved his living standards. His previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income. He still works in a restaurant. He would like to apply for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy more stock of cooking oil, wheat flour, maize flour, charcoal, rice and sugar. He thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking oil, wheat flour, maize flour, charcoal, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is thankful for her previous loan which helped her to buy clothes to sell. Here again she comes to you, asking for a loan of KES 20,000 to add stock of clothes to sell.

loans.use: to add stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a very hardworking and enterprising man who says that he has been able to greatly increase his income and help his family thanks to his hard work. He operates a retail shop and a butcher shop.

He is asking for a loan to buy more household consumables such as wheat flour, sugar, soap, tea leaves, cooking oil, and salt for his business. He is grateful for the financial support he has received.

loans.use: to buy more household consumables such as wheat flour, sugar, soap, tea leaves, cooking oil, and salt for his business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary operates a poultry selling business, selling from home to her restaurant operators and neighbours. She dreams of buying land and expanding her farming in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase more chicks and feed to maintain her business continuity and prosperity. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and feed.

loans.name: Janet's Group

texts.en:
Please meet with members of the “Janet's Group” from Dansoman, in Ghana. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a total loan of 2,200 GHS. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Janet is the featured leader of this group. The 41-year-old is married to a driver and they have two children. Janet has been a businesswoman for six years now. She sells vegetables and foodstuffs. With her share of this loan, she will buy tomatoes, garden eggs, carrots and cabbage.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, garden eggs, carrots and cabbage.

loans.name: Houng

texts.en:
Houng, who is 40 years old, is a rural villager from Battambang province's Ek Phnom district where crop farming is a popular business in the neighborhood. To make a living, he has been working as a motor-taxi driver while his wife sells fish in the village. Together, they have been engaged in this business for 20 years.

This is the sixth-cycle loan for Houng with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. The past business loans, which he successfully paid back, have helped him to sustain his living conditions as well as his business in a gradual manner. He is now asking for a loan to buy more fish for resale. He hopes to make more income from his current business.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Hamidan

texts.en: Hamidan is 56-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She has been running a business selling milk for many years. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family. At that time, her husband was the only breadwinner. Over time, her sales increased and also her income. Now she has three buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has some savings and applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her 5th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Digna Aurora

texts.es:
Digna es una mujer de  45 años tiene 6 hijos de 18, 16, 13, 11, 8 y 7 años de edad, y por quienes lucha día a día, vive en una pequeña  casa  que su madre le heredó, con el esfuerzo de  sus padres logró terminar la secundaria  para luego dedicarse a trabajar ya que por falta de recursos económicos se vio obligada a hacerlo para poder sustentar sus necesidades.  Se dedica a la venta de bonice de forma ambulante desde hace 3 años su pequeño negocio ha ido creciendo cada vez más,  A pesar de tener un trabajo que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, ella se encarga de todos los quehaceres de su hogar,  de sus hijos, en la actualidad  Digna y su familia viven en el sector de La Laguna perteneciente  a la parroquia de Ignacio Flores  de la provincia de Latacunga de  la República del Ecuador. podríamos decir que está en un nivel casi bajo , es por eso que  además de su negocio también ha tenido que ver otras fuentes de ingresos adicionales por la crianza y venta de pollos, trabaja de 11 a 12 horas , casi no tiene tiempo para compartir con sus hijos.  Está solicitando un crédito para hacer una adecuación en su vivienda para dar mejor comodidad a sus hijos.
Digna y sus hijos agradecen a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Digna is 45 years old and has six children - they are aged 18, 16, 13, 11, 8, and 7 years old respectively and it is for them that she fights every day.  Digna lives in a small house, which she inherited for her mother.  With her parents efforts, Digna was able to complete secondary school but then had to go out to work so as to pay for necessities.  Digna has been working selling Bonice ice creams as a street vendor for three years and the business is always growing.  Despite having a job that requires a lot of time and effort, Digna also does the household chores and looks after her children.  Digna and her family currently live in the La Laguna area of the Ignacio Flores parish, in the Latacunga province of Ecuador.  Digna lives in poverty and so, in addition to her business, she has had to look for additional sources of income, such as raising and selling chickens.  Digna works 11 - 12 hours per day and has almost no spare time to spend with her children.  Digna is applying for a loan in order to renovate her house to make it more comfortable for her children.

Digna and her children thank "Fundación Alternativa" in Ecuador and Kiva for making their personal and profession growth possible.

loans.use: to renovate her house to make it more comfortable for her children.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is a 24-year-old married woman. She has been running a small restaurant in her community with the support of her husband. She offers breakfast, lunch and dinner meals with chapattis and naan. In this way, she makes enough money to support a decent life.  Saima is motivated to provide her family with good food, health care, and clothing. She has improved her business to meet their day-to-day expenses. It is Saima’s third year with Kashf Foundation, and she is happily running her business with its support. Now she requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase sacks of flour as well as packs of salt, grain, and oil. She expects to boost her earnings and wishes to spend this income on the supporting her family members.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour, as well as salt, grains, and oil.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther, who is 44 years old, is single with two children who are still at school. She has been selling wigs in a small shop for 7 years now. She works from 7 AM to 6 PM daily and she is able to make a fair monthly profit. This will be Esther's fifth loan from ID-Ghana. She used the previous loans to buy wigs to resell and has successfully repaid back the loans. She used the profits to pay school fees and cover household expenses. 

Esther will use this loan to buy hair wigs. She dreams of opening a big shop for selling her products. Esther will share this loan amount of GHS 1500 with her colleague, Sarah, who sells utensils. They will hold each other accountable for repaying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy hair wigs and sell to customers.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Ella es luz dary, necesita la ayuda de kiva porque es una persona de bajos recursos y es madre cabeza de familia, tiene dos hijos pequeños y no cuenta con la ayuda económica del padre, trabaja como vendedora informal y sus ingresos son muy bajos por lo tanto quiere superarse y ser una profesional para poder brindarle una estabilidad económica a sus dos hijos y a si obtener un buen trabajo con un sueldo fijo como auxiliar de farmacia ya que como vendedora no le alcanza para suplir todas las necesidades de sus hijos y de su casa.
Ella sabe que si se hace profesional tiene muchas oportunidades de salir adelante junto a sus hijos, y a si podrá darles una buena educación a sus hijos, le agradece a kiva si la apoyan con el sueño de ser profesional ya que cuando joven tampoco contó con un padre, solo vivió con la madre y los hermanos, por eso ella no puedo darle estudio y a ella le toco sola pagarse el  bachillerato y ahora le toca seguir pagando los estudios, pero como no cuenta con la ayuda de nadie le queda muy difícil pagarse el estudio tan costoso, ya que tiene que pagar arriendo, servicios, alimentación y cuidado de sus hijos, mientras ella sale a trabajar, pero lo importante es que el esfuerzo que ella esta haciendo para poder estudiar y no quedarse estancada.
Muchas gracias por la atención prestada y la ayuda que le puedan brindar a ella porque de verdad anhela y desea ser una persona útil para la sociedad y ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
This is Luz Dary.  She needs Kiva's help because she is poor and is also a mother and the head of her family.  Luz has two young children and does not receive financial support from their father.  Luz works as a salesperson and has a very low income. Consequently she wants to do better and have a profession in order to provide her two children with financial stability and to have a better job as a pharmacy assistant, with a fixed salary. Luz's wage as a salesperson is not enough to cover her children's and her household expenses.

Luz knows that if she has a profession, she will have plenty of opportunities in order to get ahead with her children and that she will be able to give them a good upbringing.  Luz is grateful to Kiva for supporting her with her dream of becoming a professional as, when she was a child, she also did not have a father. Luz lived only with her mother and siblings and so she could not study.  She had to pay for high school herself and now she must continue to pay for her education. With no help from anyone, it is difficult for Luz to pay for such expensive studies as she must also pay her rent, utility bills, for food, and for childcare when she goes out to work.  The important things is, though, that she is making the effort to be able to study and is not doing nothing.

Thank you for reading this and for the support that you can provide to Luz.  She really does want to be a person who is of use in society and wants to be a great professional.

loans.use: to pay for one semester's tuition fees.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret, who is in her mid 30's, is married with one child who is still at school. She has been selling hair products from door to door for 10 years now. She works from 8 AM to 6 PM daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Margaret's second loan from ID-Ghana. She used the previous loan to keep buying hair products to resell and has successfully repaid back the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy hair products. She dreams of opening a shop for selling her products.

Margaret will share this loan amount of GHS 1400 with her colleague, Christiana, who also sells hair products. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy hair products (cream, shampoo, etc.) and sell to customers.

loans.name: Rasoolan

texts.en: Rasoolan is a 49-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She has been running an academy in her home for many years. She has gained a good number of students and is greatly respected in her community. She is contributing much to the family income through all of her great efforts. In order to accommodate more students, Rasoolan has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase new benches, chairs and blackboards. She expects more admissions as her academy becomes famous in her town. She desires to spend the part of the revenues on the expansion of her academy.

loans.use: to purchase new benches, chairs and blackboards.

loans.name: Ruvelyn

texts.en: Ruvelyn is 43 years old and has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy grocery items to sell such as noodles, canned goods and bread. She has earned a living by operating a retail store for the last three years and generates an income of about PHP 5,000 a month. She uses the profits she earns in her store to educate her children, but often runs out of money before all their fees are paid. So, she hopes and prays for the approval of this loan so that she can buy more of the grocery items she sells in her store because this will allow her to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as noodles, canned goods and breads.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 29 años de edad vive junto a su tía en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de productos medicinales en el centro de su distrito, es conocido por la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de productos caita, natura y llave de la salud para incrementar su negocio y de esta manera ofrecer varias alternativas para sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 29 years old and lives with his aunt in the district of Cayalti, two hours from Chiclayo on the north cast of Peru. The people here work in agriculture, commerce and raise livestock.

Carlos sell medicinal products in the center of his district and is well known for his work. He has requested a loan of 1,500 PEN to buy wild, natural products key to good health. This will increase his business, offer more alternatives for his clients and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy medical products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vitamins and animal feed.

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
Mario de 40 años de edad, casado con dos hijos, menores de edad. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañia de sus hijos. Es originaria del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, jabón, detergente, fósforos. El dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy  lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Mario agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Mario is a 40-year old man, who is married and has two minor children. He likes to spend his free time with his children. He's originally from Sauce, located in the north of the country. He's a hard-working and responsible man, and has a strong willingness of self-improvement. Unfortunately, he could not attend university and had to start working and help with household expenses when he was very young. 

Thanks to his hard work and willingness to get ahead, he runs a grocery store where he sells food items, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, soap, detergent and matches. He works for 12 hours every day. 

He plans to invest the loan in working capital and to provide his business with food products so that he can have better income in the near future. Mario is grateful to Kiva lenders for supporting people with limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to provide his business with food items, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, soap, detergent and matches.

loans.name: Josue Leonel

texts.es:
Josué Leonel de 24 años de edad, soltero sin hijos, originario de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación persona, en sus ratos libre disfruta con su familia  y amigos sanamente. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera  y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven para poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos de artesanía y bisutería como collares, aretes, anillos, pulseras, prensas para el cabello. El dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en un lugar especifico del la comunidad. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de bisutería artesal, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Josué agradece la ayuda que los inversionionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Josué Leonel, 24, is single with no children and originally from Leon, which is located in the western part of the country. He is know for being hard-working, responsible and having a drive to improve.He spends his free time with his family and friends.

Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources he could not pursue a higher education and saw the need to work from a very young age to help with household costs. Thanks to his efforts and drive to succeed, he earns income by selling handicrafts and costume jewelry like necklaces, earrings, rings, bracelets and hair clips. He works 10 hours a day offering his products. His business has a specific place in the local community. 

The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock his business with the purchase and sale of crafts so that in the not too distant future he can bring in a higher income.

Josué is grateful for the help that Kiva investors offer people of scare recourses to have a means of decent work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock up for the purchase and sale of handmade crafts such as necklaces, earrings, rings, bracelets and hair clips.

loans.name: Dinma Idalma

texts.es: Dinma de 45 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a sus hijos dado que hace algunos años se separó de su esposo quedando responsable del hogar. Dinma se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo y además con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer una pequeña tienda la cual le ayuda mucho a complementar los ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de nueva mercadería para la tienda con el fin de atraer a más clientes. Con el monto solicitado comprará prendas de vestir como: blusas, faldas, pantalones, ropa interior, etc. Espera poder lograr su objetivo de mejorar sus ventas y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Dinma is 45 years old and lives with her children in her own home. A few years ago, she separated from her husband and was left with the household responsibilities. Dinma has been providing housekeeping services for quite some time, but with great effort she was also able to open a small store. This has been a great help with supplementing her income so that she can cover her household expenses.

Dinma is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in the purchase of new merchandise for her store, which will help to attract more customers. The amount she requested will be used to buy clothing such as blouses, skirts, trousers, undergarments, and other items. She hopes to achieve her goal of increasing her sales so that she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as blouses, skirts, trousers, undergarments, and other items.

loans.name: Reyna Sulema

texts.es: Doña Reyna, habitante de un barrio conflictivo por la delincuencia lo que no deja a los vecinos descansar tranquilos, ella es comerciante vende ropa usada en su casa de habitación, su esposo es jubilado y ambos se dedican al negocio para sacarlo adelante. La señora Reyna desea terminar de construir otra parte del muro perimetral de su vivienda que ha venido haciendo por partes ya que sus condiciones económicas no le permiten cubrir este gasto de una sola vez, esta mejora le permitirá brindar comodidad a sus clientes y a su familia una mejor condición en su hogar, es por eso que solicita el crédito para comprar materiales y realizar la obra.
texts.en:
Reyna is a resident in a troubled neighbourhood (crime), which doesn't allow her neighbours any peace. She is a vendor and sells used clothing from her house. Her husband is retired and they both work in the business to come out ahead. 

Reyna desires to finish the perimeter wall around her house, with the aim of providing comfort to her clients and family. Due to economic conditions, she has not been able to do it all at once. This is why she is requesting a loan, to purchase materials and to do the work that would improve her dwelling conditions both for her family and her clients.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as cement, sand, blocks, gravel, iron.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to carry out construction in the kitchen of  her house.

loans.name: Yuris Milena

texts.es: Yuris Milena, habitante de Nueva Guinea, soltera, trabajadora activa del poder judicial desde hace cinco años, solicita el crédito para compra de material de construcción y realizar un dormitorio en su casa de habitación, de esta forma va obtener mejores condiciones de vida con su familia, es una joven responsable, honesta, su sueño es salir adelante con su familia y tener un hogar feliz y seguro.
texts.en: Yuris Milena lives in Nueva Guinea.  She is single, and has been working in the justice system for five years.  She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials to build a bedroom in her house, so as to create better living conditions for her family. She is a responsible and honest young woman whose dream is to get ahead with her family and to have a happy and secure home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Marcella

texts.en:
Marcella is 31 years old, married and her spouse provides additional income to the total family income. She supports five people with three children, aged between nine and three years. She has been in business for five years. Her monthly income is 10,000 Kenyan shillings. 

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya which she is borrowing to purchase stock of the clothes business. She plans to use the anticipated profits to save and repay the loan.  

Her future dream is to see her business grow and her family to live a successful life.

loans.use: to purchase stock of clothing

loans.name: Ey

texts.en:
Ey, aged 49 years of age, is widowed and has four children. She is a hard-working woman who runs a farming business and has a piggery business to earn additional income. She has had these two businesses for nearly 13 years and earns approximately 10,000 KHR. Ey hopes that, despite her hardships, through perseverance, she can provide enough food for her children.

Ey is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 KHR, which will be used to purchase additional piglets to raise and to buy a young cow for fattening in order to help in her family work. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Ey from HKL. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets to raise and to buy a young cow for fattening  in order to help in her family work

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is a 43-year-old man who lives in Vihiga County and is married to Mary who is a farmer in the same county.  They have four children aged 16, 14, 11 and four respectively. He sells cereals, a business he has been in for the last five years, earning a monthly income of 25,000 KES.  

He is taking a loan of 15,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya, which he intends to use to expand his business by adding more stock of the cereals in his business and to educate his children.   The anticipated proceeds will be used to repay the loan and add more shares to VisionFund Kenya account.

His dream is to bring up a stable family.

loans.use: to buy assorted cereals for resale.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 29 years old, married, and has four children. She operates a retail shop in Marereni, which she has been doing for six years. She earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

Lilian is requesting her second loan from VisionFund Kenya for 20,000 KES, which she will to use to add stock to her  business by purchasing painkillers, tea leaves, milk, sugar, salt, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, and rice. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. 

In the future, she hopes to open a wholesale shop and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase painkillers,tea leaves, milk, sugar, salr, wheat flour, cooking oil, and rice to sell

loans.name: Emanuel De Chichi Group

texts.es:
El señor Martin es soltero. De edad 42 años. De escolaridad Primaria Completa. Se dedica a la artesanía específicamente a la elaboración de Cortes Típicos. Inició este negocio ayudando a sus padres y a la fecha lleva 7 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores. Desea en el futuro ofrecer variedad de estilos de cortes y esto lo logrará si se le concede el préstamo que necesita para ampliar su capital de trabajo.

Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y artesanía.

Son 6 personas que integran el grupo, aunque en la fotografia aparecen 9, a estas 3 más no se les concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Martin 42 years old and single.  He completed primary school and now earns a living making traditional clothes.  Martin started this business in order to help his parents and he now has seven years experience with it.

Martin has organised a loan group and will use this loan to buy different coloured threads.  In the future, Martin hopes to sell different types of clothes - he will be able to do this with this loan, which he needs in order to increase his working capital.

The other members of this group have businesses selling products or making artisan products.

There are nine people in the group photo but only six were granted and will receive part of this loan.

loans.use: to buy threads.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 51 years old, a female and married. She has eight children, who are 25, 20, 18, 16, 14, 12, 10 and 8 years old, whom she supports. She is a farmer and she has been in this business for ten years where she earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

Lucy was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a loan officer and is currently taking her fourth loan of KES 20,000 which she intends to use to purchase farm chemicals and pay for plowing. Lucy will use the anticipated profits to improve her farming. 

Her dreams for the future of her business and family are to expand her farming activities and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy farm chemicals and do plowing.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is appreciative of his previous loan that improved his living standards and enabled him get more profits, which he used for the family expenses. He also sells milk.

He would like to apply for a loan of ksh. 50,000 to buy more spare parts for his business. He thanks Yehu for their financial support

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for his business.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a 48-year-old lady from Kakamega. She is married to Vincent, and they have two children, aged 17 and 14 years, respectively.

She operates a salon, a business she has done for the past 18 years, earning a monthly income of 16,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). She is taking her second loan of 15,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya to use in buying a machine for the salon and increasing her stock of oils and braids. 

She will use her anticipated profits to repay her loan and do some saving. She has a dream of opening a hairdressing school.

loans.use: to buy a blow dryer, oils and braids

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 34 years old, married to Mary, and a father of three children. All of his children are in school. Amos does dairy farming, in the outskirts of Kangemi. He has been in this business for four years and gets a monthly income of twenty-three thousand shillings. 

This will be Amos's third loan with VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use the entire loan to buy a dairy cow and be in a position to educate his children to the highest level possible in future.

loans.use: to purchase another dairy cow

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en:
Everlyn is a 32-year-old married woman.  She has and supports three children who are 14, 8, and 4 years old.  She was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by one of the officer's and she has a retail shop (Mali Mali). She has been in this business for seven years.  In her business she earns a monthly income of KES 7,850.  

She is taking her second loan of KES 25,000 which she intends to use to buy more plastic utensils for her shop.  Everlyn will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.  

Her dreams for the future of her business and family is to grow her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy plastic utensils to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Griselda Marisol

texts.es:
Griselda, necesita un nuevo crédito para fortalecer la tienda,la pupusería y tambien vende verduras, invertirá en la compra de repollo, aceite, bebidas, quesillo, verduras, aderezos, golosinas, etc., con lo que su negocio estará debidamente equipado para continuar teniendo satisfechos a sus clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior surtió el negocio con lo que tuvo las ganancias con las que ha cancelado sus deudas y ha hecho mejoras  en su vivienda, continúa luchando para tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Griselda needs a new loan to build up her store- a pupusería (pupusas are a traditional Salvadoran snack consisting of stuffed, grilled tortillas) and vegetable store. She will invest in the purchase of cabbage, cooking oil, drinks, soft cheese, tomatoes, garnishes, candy, etc, with which her business will be properly equipped to continue satisfying her customers. 

With the earlier loan she stocked her business, and therefore had earnings with which she paid off her debts and made improvements to her home. She   continue to strive to have her own sales outlet.

loans.use: To buy cabbage, cooking oil, drinks, soft cheese, tomatoes, garnishes and candy.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, opta por un nuevo crédito ya que le facilita el fortalecimiento de su negocio, con el capital invertirá en la compra de variedad de ropa y pago de mano de obra para la recolección de la cosecha de maíz y frijol.La compra de ropa es debido a la temporada de fin de año
Con la inversión anterior Julio fortaleció su negocio, su economía mejoro y le ha dado la oportunidad de cancelar sus deudas y continuar mejorando el estilo de vida de su familia, sus hijos continúan dedicándose a estudiar.
texts.en:
Julio is opting for a new loan to facilitate the strengthening of his business. He will invest the capital into the purchase of a variety of clothes and manual labor to collect the corn and bean harvest. He needs to buy new clothes due to the winter season.
With the previous investment, Julio strengthened his business. His economy improved and it gave him the opportunity to cancel his debts and continue improving his lifestyle for his family. His children continue to devote themselves to their studies.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes and manual labor for collection of the corn and bean harvest.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo crédito que le ayude a surtir el negocio con mucha rapidez, con el capital comprara frutas y verduras y variedad de ropa nueva, para mejorar las opciones de compra para sus clientes y aprovechar las fiestas navideñas en las que las ventas son mejores.
Con el crédito anterior surtió el inventario de la venta de frutasy verduras lo que le dio como resultado más clientes satisfechos, mejores ventas e ingresos extras con los que ha cancelado las cuotas y continua a poyando con los gastos familiares.
texts.en: María finds it necessary to request another loan to help her stock her business as quickly as possible. With the money she will buy a variety of fruits, vegetables, and new clothes in order to increase the options available to her clients and to take advantage of the Christmas festivities when sales are the best. With the last loan she stocked her inventory with fruit and vegetables which satisfied her clients and increased her sales and profits. She paid off her loan and continued to help pay the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables like apples, pears, grapes, potatoes, and chayotes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jose Rogelio

texts.es:
José, se dispone a adquirir materia prima por mayor para su negocio para continuar trabajando y dando un mejor servicio a sus clientes e su pupuseria, comprara tomates, repollo, frijol, aceite y gas propano.
Con el préstamo anterior mejoro su producción de pupusas,ya que le ayudo a comprar los ingredientes necesartios para el negocio, tiene  muchos clientes nuevos, da un mejor servicio, su economía es más estable y su estilo familiar a mejorado.
texts.en:
José needs to purchase wholesale raw materials for his business to be able to continue working and giving a better service to his customers at his pupuseria. He will purchase tomatoes, cabbage, beans, oil, and propane gas.
With the previous loan he improved his production of pupusas that helped him buy necessary ingredients for his business. He has many new customers and gives a better service. His economy is more stable and his family's lifestyle has improved.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbage, beans, oil, and propane gas.

loans.name: Candelaria  Del Carmen

texts.es: Candelaria es originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de comida rápida (repochetas, enchiladas etc.), el cual cuenta con su negocio muy rentable. Se siente agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito ya que mejoro las condiciones de su negocio, aumentado la producción de sus comidas. Solicita un crédito para comprar aceite, harina de maíz, arroz, leña, carnes entre otros, con el fin de ofrecer comidas de calidad. Estima que el crédito ya que incrementara sus ventas y obtener mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Candelaria is from the city of Granada.  She is a merchant who sells fast food (repochetas, enchiladas, etc.) and she has a very profitable business.  She is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito because her business conditions and food production have improved.  She is asking for a loan to buy cooking oil, corn flour, firewood, meats, and other things for her dishes.  She estimated that the loan will increase her sales and that she will be able to obtain better earnings for her family.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, corn flour, firewood, meats, and other things for her dishes

loans.name: Aseda

texts.en:
Aseda is 44 years old, married and has four children (two sons and two daughters).  Aseda is a housewife and uneducated and can only sign her name. His husband, Samsul, aged 52 years, is engaged in a business of buying and selling cows. He is also illiterate. Their two daughters are receiving education and are in grade 10 and 7 respectively. Their two sons are engaged in agricultural work. They reside in the small village of West Magurmari in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own kachha house (mud, wood and straw-made).

The earnings from her husband's and sons' business are too small to give the family a decent lifestyle. It is very difficult for them to meet all the expenses of a six-member family.

Aseda is a wholehearted, good and industrious woman. She heard about BJS and decided to take a loan to purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply and dairy products (butter, paneer and curd) business. She hopes that the income from this business will be profitable, as the products are in great demand in the present market.

Her goals are to contribute to the betterment of their living conditions, give better education to their children, and in the future, buy more cows with the profit from her business.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply and dairy products business.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina, age 42, is in business of animal sales. She buys animals such as baby goats at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to support her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase two more baby goats.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en: Shagufta is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been selling fruits for the past five years. She is very enthusiastic and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a loving mother to three daughters and three sons. She is responsible for their food, health, and education and tries hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. For the improvement for her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase sacks of apples, oranges, and guavas. This will help her to meet market demands consistently. Shagufta dreams of providing better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, oranges, and guavas.

loans.name: Candida

texts.es:
Candida de 66 años de edad,  no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar es casada,  el esposo se dedica a la agricultura y a la pesca. Candida ha procreado 4 hijos con su esposo los 4  ya tienen hogares apartes,  en la casa solamente vive ella su esposo y una nieta por lo tanto solamente ellos dependen de ella.

Ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, este negocio lo tiene ya desde hace tres años oficio que aprendió de la mamá y también vende pescado fresco; este negocio ella lo hace por todo el barrio, solamente ella se involucra.


Con el préstamo solicitado en Fundación Campo, comprara lamina y madera  para abrir un cafetín frente a la casa;  ya que las demás tiendas quedan a bastante distanciada y ha visto la posibilidad de poner una tienda; pero también ella comprara verdura y frutas ya que ella toda las mañana sale para la ciudad a comprar las frutas y verduras para venderlas por todo el barrio. Ella comprara zanahoria, papas, güisquiles, repollo, pepino, tomates, guineo de toda las cosas que ya ella vende con clientes, que ya saben la hora que pasan   por su casa.  

Uno de los sueños, es tener su negocio en la casa ya que es un barrio bastante poblado y si tiene fe, que le va a funcionar el negocio con el cafetín,  para así tener más ingresos y poder sacar adelante a su nieta.
texts.en:
Candida, who is 66 years old, did not have the opportunity to attend school. She is married, and her husband works in agriculture and fishing. Candida and her husband have 4 children who already have their own homes, and she lives in the house with just her husband and her granddaughter, so they are the only ones who depend on her.

She has been selling fruit and vegetables for three years now--a business that she learned from her mother--and she also sells fish. Her business serves the whole neighborhood, and she runs it on her own.

With the requested loan from Fundación Campo she will purchase sheeting and wood to open snack stand, as the rest of the shops are quite far away, and she has seen the possibility of opening a store.

But she will also purchase vegetables and fruit, as she goes to the city every morning to buy fruit and vegetables in order to sell them throughout the neighborhood. She will purchase carrots, potatoes, pear squash, cabbage, cucumbers, tomatoes, and bananas--all the things that she already sells to her customers--who already know when to go to her house.

One of her dreams is to have her business in her house, as her neighborhood is well populated; and if she has faith, her business will work well with the snack stand.  This way she will have more income and be able to raise her granddaughter.

loans.use: to purchase sheeting and wood to open a snack stand.

loans.name: Yuly Maritza

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar al colegio de Yuli, quien  con su credikiva hizo adecuaciones locativas y mejoró su piso. Los estudiantes están mas confortables y la imagen de su institución mejoró mucho. Elal está muy agradecida y pide que sigan apoyando a las personas que tienen negocios. En la actualidad está aplicando aun nevo creidkiva, mediante el cual compará una vez mas materiales cosntructivos, para aprovechar las vacaciones y hacer muchas mas mejoras en su cubierta, cielo raso y  paredes, que ofrezcan un ambiente confortable y seguro a sus pequeños educandos.
texts.en:
Thanks to the support given to Yuli's college, Yuli made improvements to the school and improved the floor with the last loan from Kiva. The students are more comfortable and the appearance of the institution is much better. She is very pleased and asks that you continue to support people who have their own businesses. 

Yuli is now requesting a new loan from Kiva  She will use it to purchase more construction materials and take advantage of the vacations to make improvements on the deck, ceiling and walls to offer a more secure and comfortable environment for her students.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make improvements in her deck, ceiling and walls.

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a José  en su restaurante de comidas rápidas, pues con su credikiva logró,  incrementar sus inventarios y sus ventas. Comprando materias primas e insumos en un mayor volumen. Sus condiciones habitacionales mejoraron y con ello ha logrado parte de sus metas. Hoy está aplicando nuevamente a un nuevo financiamiento mediante el cual comprará, arroz, aceite etc, además de ropa que de su cliente tiene encargada.   José tambien está preparándose para producir muchos tamales navideños, porque desde ahora, su clientela le ha encargado, haciendo de sus credikiva una exitosa inversión.
texts.en:
Thsnks for supporting José in his fast food restaurant as with his last loan from Kiva he was able to increase his inventory and sales. He bought raw materials and supplies in greater volume. His living conditions have improved and he has achieved part of his goal.

Now José is asking once again for a loan with which he will buy rice, oil, etc. Plus he will buy clothing which customers have ordered from him. José is also preparing to sell a lot of Holiday tamales, because his customers are now making orders. This will make his loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, etc. plus clothing to re-sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is thankful for his previous loan that improved his living standards. His previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income that he used to improve his business. He would like to apply for a loan of 50,000  KES to buy more goats to resell. He thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more goats to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es:
Doña Blanca, de 51 años de edad, viene desempeñándose en el campo de las ventas prácticamente desde que era niña. Su familia ha sido de comerciantes, por lo cual sus habilidades para desempeñar esta actividad le fueron inculcadas siempre. Actualmente realiza ventas por encargo y también posee un pequeño almacén en su casa. Es una trabajadora incansable, que todos los días sale en busca de generar los ingresos que tanto requiere para su sostenimiento, y que le permitan ir construyendo el sueño que persigue, y que es poder tener un punto de venta más grande, y desde donde pueda ofrecer un mayor número de productos.

Con el crédito busca comprar mercancía para la temporada de fin de año, como bolsos, cremas, perfumes, entre otras cosas, y a su vez, generar ingresos que le permitan poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca is 51 years old and has been selling since she was a little girl.  Her family have been merchants for a long time and her abilities were always being used for this.  She currently sells on order and also has a small store in her home.  She is a tireless worker every day searches for new income that she needs to support herself and that allow her to build the dream she is following, having another, larger, store where she can offer a greater number of products.

She will use the money from this loan to buy seasonal merchandise such as purses, creams, perfumes, and other things so she can generate more income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge, esta separado vive solo en casa de los sobrinos en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz,  de profesión confeccionista de sombreros.
 
Actualmente trabaja por mas de ocho horas en su propio domicilio; tiene una sola maquina con la cual trabaja, los dias sabados va directo a una de las ferias populares de La Paz, lugar donde hace la entrega de sus pedidos, con esta actividad el se mantiene y cubre sus mínimas necesidades ya que vive solo y no cuenta con ninguna ayuda a pesar de vivoir en casa de sus sobrinos.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito para la compra de material: forros, telas, cintas de adorno en IMPRO y la primera vez en KIVA.
texts.en:
Jorge is separated.  He lives by himself in a home his nephews own in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz.  He is a hat maker.

Currently he works for more than eight hours from his own home.  He has just one machine with which he works.  On Saturdays he goes straight to one of the popular markets in La Paz, where he makes delivery of his orders.  With this work he takes care of and covers his basic needs, because he lives alone and doesn’t count on any help a part from living in a house his nephews own.

This is the first time that he has asked for a loan from IMPRO, and the first time from KIVA, for the purchase of material: linings, fabrics, and decorative ribbons.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, linings, and ribbons for his business manufacturing hats.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta de 19 años de edad es madre soltera de una hija de 8 meses y habita en casa sencilla pero propia junto a su pequeña hija y su grupo familiar. Marta es una joven trabajadora quien se gana la vida trabajando en un supermercado cercano a su localidad. Desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra láminas, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo la casa ya que se encuentran en mal estado. Además, desea comprar una puerta metálica para dar mayor seguridad a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marta, age 19, is the single mother of an 8-month-old daughter.  The house she lives in together with her daughter and family is simple, but it is her own. Marta is a hardworking young woman who earns her living working in a nearby supermarket in her neighborhood.  

Marta wants to improve the condition of her home, so she has made the decision to ask for a loan from FUSAI.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of metal sheeting, wood, and nails to change the roof of the house, because it is in bad shape.  Also, she wants to buy a metal door to make her home more secure.

loans.use: to buy wood, metal sheeting, nails, and a door to improve the roof of her home.

loans.name: Sara Del Carmen

texts.es: Sara de 29 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo  y sus dos hijos de 5 años y 8 meses de edad. Sara se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva desde hace 4 años. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante y gracias a su experiencia y buenos productos cuenta con muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Desea terminar el corredor de su vivienda y encementar el piso ya que actualmente es de tierra. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, polines, cemento, arena y grava.
texts.en:
Sara is 29 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their two children aged 5, and 8 months. Sara has made a living selling new clothes for the past four years. She is a door to door seller, and thanks to her experience and her high quality products, she has a lot of customers who grow by the day. 

She wants to finish off the hall in her home and lay cement on the floor, which is currently bare earth. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying galvanized sheeting, poles, cement, sand and gravel..

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, poles, cement, sand and gravel.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El señor Javier se dedica actualmente a la cura de dientes y muelas (dentista) en su propio domicilio (mejor dicho en un espacio reducido de su sala) no teniendo el espacio y la infraestructura requerida para esta profesion por falta de recursos economicos, vive en  compañia de su esposa e hijos en la zona de miraflores de  la ciudad de La Paz.  Su esposa persivira una ayuda salarial de parte de sus parientes que le ofrecieron un pequeño trabajo extra.
Javier necesita el credito para hacer compra de materia prima para su profesion y un pequeño equipo de limpieza que son necesarios para su actividad, y de esta manera  poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a su pequeña clientela.

El sueño de Javier es poder dar a sus hijas una educacion profesional y tener su propio consultorio dental bien ubicado para prestar un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Javier G. cares for teeth and molars (dentist) in his home (in other words he has a space set up in his home).  He doesn’t have an office due to a lack of financial resources.  He lives with his wife in the miraflores area in La Paz.  His wife helps him with her small salary from a couple of relatives who offered her some extra work.

Javier needs this loan to buy supplies for his profession and some cleaning equipment that he needs.  In this way he will be able to provide better service to his small number of customers.

Javier’s dream is to be able to provide a professional education to his daughters and to have his own dental office in a good location so he can provide good service.

loans.use: to buy dental equipment.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: Marcos de 45 años  de edad, se dedica a la venta de pescado en el centro de la ciudad.  Desde el año 2009, cuando trabajaba en su restaurante, aprendió a conocer el pescado, comprándolo para el consumo de los clientes y allí encontró la oportunidad de negocios, cuando los proveedores le ofrecieron generar más ingresos, comercializando productos del mar. Así que su día empezó a transcurrir entre lebranches, bocachicos, mojarras etc, los cuales  hoy, vende principalmente a restaurantes, ubicados en el la zona comercial del centro de la ciudad, a quienes ofrece los productos  de contado, trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 12 del día. Su meta mas adelante, es tener estructurado un local, y posicionarse en el sector más comercial de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Marcos planea el mejoramiento de su estructura para tratar de responder a su creciente clientela, para ello requiere un enfriador para llenarlo de pescados  y vender mucho más en esta época navideña y de final de año, temporada donde se incrementa el consumo de los clientes de los restaurantes, mientras Marcos vende y vende mucho mas, aprovechando su credikiva, al cual está aplicando para hacer la inversión de pescado y un enfriador.
texts.en:
Marcos is 45 years old. He sells fish in the center of the city. Since 2009 when he worked in his restaurant he learned about fish, buying them for his customers to eat. And here he found the possibility of a business when the suppliers offered him the opportunity to generate more income selling sea-foods. So he starts his day searching for mullet, bocachico, and mojarra (siver perch) which he sells mainly to restaurants located in the center of the city. He offers his product for cash. He works from 8 am until noon.

His goal is to open his own shop located in the most commercial area of the city of Barranquilla. Marcos plans to improve his infrastructure to respond to his growing clientele. To do this he needs a cooler to fill with the fish and sell much more in the Christmas and End of Year celebrations. At this time the consumption by customers in restaurants increases. So Marcos sells more and more, taking advantage of his Kiva loan which he is requesting in order to invest in fish and a cooler.

loans.use: to buy fish and a cooler.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria  es una señora que actualmente se encuentra separada de su esposos con el que tuvo 2 hijas, vive en su casa  junto a su hija en la zona Norte de la ciudad de La Paz.  Se dedica al expendio de comida en un pequeño restaurante que aperturaron en los bajos de su mismo domicilio, ella persive una pequeña ayuda de su esposo por concepto de ayuda familiar. Maria necesita el credito para hacer la compra de un refrigerador y otros insumos necesarios para su actividad, y asi de esta manera  poder ofrecer un mejor servicio y hacer frente a los gastos que tiene en su hogar.

El sueño de Maria es poder dar a sus hijas una educacion adecuada y una profesion factible para que puedan sobre salir en el futuro.
texts.en:
Maria is separated from her husband they have two daughters.  She lives with her daughter in the North zone of La Paz and makes food in her small restaurant that she set up in the lower part of her home.  She gets a little help from her husband.  Maria needs a loan to buy a refrigerator and other supplies so she can provide better service pay her household expenses.

Maria’s dream is to be able to provide a good education and profession for her daughters so that they can succeed in the future.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and supplies.

loans.name: Arati

texts.en:
Arati is 44 years old, married and together with her husband, is raising three sons. She is married to Sudhir, who is 50 years old and a farmer by profession. Both Arati and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. They are from the remote village of Magurmari in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Their three sons are the students in secondary school.

Arati’s husband started growing crops before ten years ago. He grows different vegetables in different seasons. Arati also assists her husband in his work. He sells his products in the local market and earns for his family. 

As the prices of essential things are going up day by day, it is hardly possible for him to run the family with his small income. Now, they decided to start cultivation of beans on their land and will sell them in the market because it is a profitable business nowadays. To start a new business, they require capital.

Arati has taken loan from BJS to purchase bean seeds and fertilizers to start cultivation on their land. The profits from the business will be used to upgrade their poor financial condition and especially to bear the educational expenses of their children.

Arati dreams to make a concrete-made house for them in the future with the return from her business.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase bean seeds and fertilizers for cultivating beans.

loans.name: Lourdes Angelica

texts.es:
Lourdes tiene 33 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con dos hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Aso. 10 de Septiembre que esta ubicado en Lechugalito es un recinto que pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  

Lourdes trabaja en la agricultura en la siembra maiz y a la crianza de pollos y cerdos para incrementar la economía de la familia.  El cultivo que más sobresale es el maíz, los productos los vende en el mercado de Ventanas.

El socio solicita el crédito para la agricultura, compra de urea, semillas, fertilizantes y  balanceados de engorde y crianza de pollos y cerdos.

El sueño es superarse en las ventas para dar mejor nivel de vida a la familia.

En los tiempos libres les gusta descansar y ver la television.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 33 years old, and lives with his spouse and 2 children.  He lives in Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province.

He is a member of the "10 de Septiembre" communal bank, located in Lechugalito.  This is a district of Ventanas canton in Los Rios province.

Lourdes works as a farmer cultivating corn and raising chickens and pigs in order to increase the household finances.  What he cultivates most of all is corn.  He sells his products in the Ventanas market.

Lourdes is requesting a loan for agricultural supplies such as: urea, seeds, fertilizers, and animal feed to raise and fatten the chickens and pigs.

His dream is to increase his sales so that he can give his family a better standard of living.

In his free time, he enjoys resting and watching television.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, fertilizers, and animal feed

loans.name: Fuzayl

texts.en:
Fuzayl is a kind and sociable man. He is a hardworking man with a great desire to progress in life. His lifetime partner is a housewife, and they have two children. They live in the house he has succeeded in building, thanks to his great dedication, in a rural area.
 
He is one of the successful businessmen of his town. For more than six years he has been busy selling technology items. He sells computers, DVD discs, antennas, etc.  He knows all aspects of his business very well. His experience and skill help him to develop the business and in this way improve living conditions. His brother Zuhayl helps him with the business. 

Fuzayl wants to develop the business further but his income is small and he needs your help and mercy. He is asking for a loan of TJS 10,000  to buy technology items to increase the working capital. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy technology items to increase his working capital

loans.name: Kenjegul

texts.ru: Кенжегул 37 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Кенжегул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кенжегул занимается животноводством, стартовав 17 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кенжегул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кенжегул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом- на покупку коров для откорма и реализации по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Кенжегул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Kenjegul is 37 years old, married, and together with her husband is bringing up four children. Kenjegul has a high school educaiton. As a main source of income for her family, Kenjegul raises cattle, having begun 17 year ago with a livestock purchase of 5,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Kenjegul currently has on her homestead: one dairy cow and one calf. Monthly income consists of 5,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Kenjegul applied to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy cows for fattening and selling at a high price.

Kenjegul plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating the number of domestic livestock, and plans to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Matano

texts.en:
Matano is a married man with one child who is still young. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past ten years, he has operated a kiosk, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He mentioned price fluctuations as his major challenge. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan of 50,000 KES, he wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets to resell. He decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets to resell.

loans.name: Toktokan

texts.ru: Токтокан 46 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей. Токтокан многодетная и счастливая мать. Три сына находятся на заработках в России, ежемесячно высылают часть зарплаты на поддержание семьи, остальные дети -школьники, учатся и в свободное время помогают Токтокан по хозяйству. Супруг изготавливает из дерева национальный музыкальный инструмент, который называется комуз. Очень мало людей, которые могут изготавливать такие инструменты и супруг Токтокан входит в число этих людей. Изготавливает комузы на заказ, имеет небольшой доход. У Токтокан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Токтокан занимается животноводством, стартовав 13 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Токтокан и ее детей, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 нетель, 5 овец, 10 коз. Также на территории дома у Токтокан  имеется небольшой сад с яблонями и сливами. Осенью после сбора урожая Токтокан  варит варенье и компоты для своей семьи из яблок и слив. А оставшуюся часть фруктов и ягод реализует продавцам. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). У Токтокан очень дружная и музыкальная семья, супруг Токтокан сам изготавливает, играет и поет на комузе, дети подпевают. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Токтокан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Токтокан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового помещения для домашнего скота взамен старого.
texts.en:
Toktokan is 46 years old, married, and together with her husband is bringing up six children. Toktokan is a happy mother with many children. Three sons are working abroad in Russia and they send part of their salary every month to support the family. The remaining children are school age, and in their free time help Toktokan around the homestead. Her husband manufactures national musical instruments called "komuz" from wood. Very few people can manufacture such instruments and Toktokan's husband is among them. He makes komuzes on order and has a small income.

Toktokan has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Toktokan raises livestock, having started 13 years ago with a livestock purchase of 10,000 som KGS. Thanks to the hard work of Toktokan and her children, the homestead currently has: one heifer, five sheep, and ten goats. Also on the territory of the house, Toktokan has a small garden with apple and plum trees. In the autumn after collecting the crop, Toktokan prepares jam and compotes for her family from apples and plums. And the remaining portion of fruit and berries are sold. Monthly income consists of 20,000 som (KGS).

Toktokan has a very friendly and musical family: Toktokan's husband himself manufactures, plays and sings with the komuz and the children sign along.

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Toktokan turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy sheep to increase the livestock headcount.

Toktokan plans to invest income from the loan to further propagate the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money for the construction of a new building for livestock to replace the old one.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified potato seed and supplies to plant and fertilize.

loans.name: Christian Alejandro

texts.es:
Christian Alejandro es cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Christian tiene 24 años y es soltero. Él se dedica al comercio desde hace 2 años, inició ayudándole a sus papás en su puesto de tacos y cuando se dio cuenta que por la zona no se vendía pizza decidió poner su negocio de ese giro. Aparte de su negocio Christian es vocalista en un grupo llama Agua Nueva Tropical.

Vende pizzas mini, medianas y familiar de estilo hawaiana, atún, pepperoni, salchicha y mexicana en la esquina de su casa por las noches. Este préstamo lo pide para invertir en su negocio, quiere comprar un horno más grande, unas lonas, mesas y bancos para darle mejor presentación a su negocio. 

Con el trabajo en su negocio Christian quiere lograr comprarse un automóvil, un refrigerador y hacer  mejoras  a su departamento.
texts.en:
Christian Alejandro is a member of Kubo Financiero and this is his story:

Christian is 24 years old and single. He's been working in the trade for 2 years. He started helping his parents selling tacos and when he realized that there wasn't anyone selling pizzas in his area, he decided to shift his business more towards that direction.   Apart from his business, Christian is a singer in a group called Agua Nueva Tropical (Fresh Tropical Water). 

He sells mini, medium, and family-sized pizzas, Hawaiian-style, tuna, pepperoni, sausage, and Mexican pizza on the corner of his house at night. He asks for this loan so that he can invest in his business. He wants to buy a bigger oven, tarps, tables, and benches so that he can make his business more presentable.

From the work done in his business, Christian wants to buy a car, a refrigerator, and make improvements to his apartment.

loans.use: to invest in his business by purchasing an oven, tables, and benches

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andrés vive en la casa de sus Padres en la zona Leon de la ciudad de El Alto.
Andrés se dedica a la confeccion de ropas de bebe y chalecos en su propio domicilio, y  necesita el crédito para compra de una maquina overlock. Asi incrementara mucho mas su produccion pues acabará la confección mucho más rápido y tendrá opción a mejorar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Andrés es tener un taller amplio de costura, asi mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Andrés lives in his parents' house in the León area of the city of El Alto.

Andrés earns a living making baby clothes and vests in his own home.  He needs the loan to buy an overlock machine, which will increase his production a lot because he'll finish much more quickly and be able to improve his income.

Andrés's dream is to have a large tailor shop to improve his income and his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine for his business making baby clothes and vests

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El socio Carlos continua perteneciendo al banco comunal YANAPAKUY y sigue dedicándose al negocio de compra de y venta de madera, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de madera.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Carlos continues as a member of Yanapakuy Communal Bank and still works in his business buying and selling wood.  He has had this business for some time and it's going well for him because of the effort he puts into it every day.  He wants to be able to keep on working so he can continue to support his family.

Carlos is requesting the loan to buy wood.

He's grateful for the loan granted and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Sumaq Paqari Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “SUMAQ PAQARI” en la comunidad de Cotañi. Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la agricultura, a la ganadería, a la venta de comestibles, al engorde de ganado y a la crianza de animales menores. Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 

José nació en la comunidad de Cotañi y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació, él tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Su actividad económica principal es la albañilería, a la agricultura, la ganadería y la crianza de animales como ovejas, vacas, cuyes, chanchos y gallinas, él tambien se dedica a la artesanía o sea hace chulos, mantas, chalinas a base de lana de alpaca y oveja. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumaq Paqari” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar lana de alpaca y oveja. 

La comunidad de Cotañi pertenece al distrito de Huancarani dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú). 

(La persona que aparece en la parte inferior de la fotografía se tuvo que tomarla su fotografía en otro día).
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the village bank "Sumac Paqari" in the community of Cotañi. This bank is made up of people who are always looking for an opportunity to get ahead, and to give their children a better future by working hard every day. The members work in farming, livestock, food sales, cattle fattening and small animal husbandry. The members are grateful for the opportunity given to them and promise to make their payments in the established time periods.

José, 43, was born in the community of Cotañi and still lives there. He is married and has five children. He is a hardworking and dedicated person who gets ahead through a lot of effort and work. His main work is as a mason, and also farming, livestock and small animal husbandry. He raises animals like sheep, cows, guinea pigs, pigs and hens. He also is an artisan, making hats, blankets and scarves from alpaca and sheep's wool.

He has been a member of the "Sumaq Paqair" village bank for some years, and on this occasion he needs a loan to buy alpaca and sheep wool.

The community of Cotañi belongs to the district of Huancarani in the province of Paucartambo, department of Cusco, Perú. The person at the bottom of the photograph had to take her picture on another day.

loans.use: to buy sheep and alpaca wool.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es:
Eduarda agradece a los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y por el préstamo pues le ayudo a incrementar el capital del negocio, ella continua dedicándose a la agricultura, a la ganadería y a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, chanchos y etc. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes. 

(La ciudad de Pilco - Grande está ubicada en el distrito de Challabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Eduarda is grateful to the lenders for their offered support and for the loan, because it helped her to increase her working capital. She continues working in agriculture, livestock farming and raising small animals such as guinea pigs, hens, pigs, etc. This time, she needs the loan in order to purchase small animals like guinea pigs.

(The city of Pilco - Grande is located in the district of Challabamba within the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, Perú).

loans.use: to buy small animals such as guinea pigs, hens, pics, etc.

loans.name: Villa Rayanniyoc Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VILLA RAYANIYOC”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Taray, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Felicia ella es conviviente y tiene 33 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
La socia que esta tapada con un circulo su cara ya no pertenece al banco comunal Villa rayaniyoc.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de verduras.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the Villa Rayaniyoc communal bank. This group is located in the Taray district, which is part of Calca province in Cusco department.

The borrower is Felicia. She is 33 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child. The borrower works in her business raising and selling animals. She raises guinea pigs and chickens. She fattens them, watches them grow, and then sells them in the various markets. By means of this small business, she is raising her children. The borrower's dream is to have a place to sell her guinea pigs and chickens. She is requesting the loan in order to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and feed for the animals.

The borrower whose face is covered with a circle no longer belongs to the Villa Rayaniyoc communal bank.

The other members have businesses such as selling animals, agriculture, grocery store and selling vegetables.

The borrower is grateful to those who form part of this dream in this way, and promises to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs, chickens, and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el Caserío Chaupe una zona rural del distrito de Querocotillo, una comunidad que se caracteriza por dedicarse a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Cutervo, que se encuentra en la región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cultivo de maíz y menestras desde hace ocho años, es un padre emprendedor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos, con la compra de abono y pago de mano de obra de su cultivo de maíz y de esta manera tener una cosecha oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Wilson is 35 years old. He lives with his wife in Caserío Chaupe, a rural area in the district of Querocotillo. The community is characterized by agriculture, commerce, and ranching, and is located two hours from the city of Cutervo, in the Cajamarca region in the mountainous northern region of Perú.

He makes a living in agriculture, growing corn and beans for 8 years. He is an enterprising father. He has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to maintain his crops by purchasing fertilizer and pay workers to harvest his corn crops. This way, he will have an appropriate harvest to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to maintain his crops and to pay workers to harvest his corn corps.

loans.name: Jovanny

texts.es:
Jovanny tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Chulucanas, una comunidad que se caracteriza por dedicarse a la elaboración de artesanías, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, que se pertenece a la Provincia de Morropon, que se encuentra ubicado en la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo tienen una tienda donde se dedican a la comercialización de frutas, abarrotes y ropa, su esposo se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado, son una familia emprendedora, Jovanny ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para comprar ropa de temporada primavera- verano y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes, para generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jovanny, age 36, lives with her husband in the Chulucanas district.  The community is known for making handicrafts, and the population works in agriculture, commerce, and with livestock.  It is in the region of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

She and her husband have a store where they sell fruit, groceries, and clothes.  Her husband raises and sells livestock.  

Jovanny has requested a loan for 2,000 soles to buy clothes for the spring-summer season.  She will offer them to her customers in order to generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the spring-summer season.

loans.name: Elly

texts.en:
Elly is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as being patient. 

Elly operates a retail store where he sells spare parts for electronics. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a viable place and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. 

Elly will use the KES 50,000 loan to add a stock of electronic spare parts. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be successful. 

This is Elly's third loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). His previous loan of KES 50,000 was successfully repaid. Elly will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to add a stock of electronic spare parts to his business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman. She describes herself as an outgoing person. 

Gladys operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, bananas, coconuts, onions, etc. Her primary customers are local residents. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit six family members. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). Her previous loan of KES 40,000 was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis tiene 27 años de edad estado civil Unión Libre vive con su esposa e hijo de 4 años. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
